title: Fullstack Developer
description:
Deine Einstiegsmöglichkeit bei Sopra Steria

Wir sind heute [movers] und morgen [shapers].

Als [movers] sind wir strategische und überzeugende Vordenker*innen in einer der führenden europäischen Management- und Technologieberatungen. Wir unterstützen unsere Kunden, treiben Ideen voran und inspirieren. Als [shapers] formen wir konkrete Lösungen und gestalten Prozesse. Wir nutzen innovative Technologien und eröffnen so neue Wege. So ist jede*r von uns stets beides: [mover & shaper]. Gemeinsam sind wir in Deutschland und Österreich rund 2.400 [movers & shapers] und uns alle eint das Ziel, mithilfe innovativer Technologien unsere Zukunft und die unserer Kunden in einem digitalen Europa erfolgreich zu gestalten.

Bei uns warten verschiedenste Projekte aus den Branchen Banking, Insurance, Public Sector, Aerospace, Automotive, Telecommunications, Energy Utilities auf Dich. Du hast bereits Branchen-Präferenzen? Teile sie uns gerne mit.

Vielfalt ist eine wichtige Grundlage unserer Unternehmenskultur. Wir möchten ein inklusives Umfeld schaffen, das die Diversität all unserer Mitarbeitenden berücksichtigt und in dem Du Dich bestmöglich entfalten kannst. Denn wir bei Sopra Steria sind davon überzeugt, dass Deine Individualität der Schlüssel zu einem nachhaltigen Unternehmenserfolg ist.

Bist Du auch ein [mover & shaper]? Dann suchen wir Dich unbefristet als:
Professional
Fullstack Developer (m/w/d)
Das erwartet Dich als [mover & shaper]

    Du entwickelst nach dem Clean Code Ansatz beispielsweise mit Java und/oder Kotlin sowie Web-Frameworks auf Basis von Javascript bei unseren Kunden
    Du trägst maßgeblich zur Entwicklung und Pflege neuer und bestehender Anwendungen bei
    Du agierst als beratende Entwicklerin oder beratender Entwickler auf Augenhöhe mit unseren Kunden
    Du unterstützt bei der Einführung von CI/CD-Prozessen zur Erhöhung der Liefergeschwindigkeit von Software-Lösungen
    Flexible Arbeitszeiten und situationsabhängig auch Remote Projekte bieten Dir einen Gestaltungsspielraum, den Du zu nutzen weißt

Das macht Dich zum [mover & shaper]

    Du verfügst über ein abgeschlossenes Studium der (Wirtschafts-) Informatik, -Mathematik, Wirtschaftswissenschaften oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung
    Du bringst erste Berufserfahrungen im (Web-) Development mit JavaScript und Java mit
    Idealerweise hast du bereits Erfahrungen in Angular und/oder React gemacht
    Du hast bestenfalls Kenntnisse im Bereich CI/CD
    Du hast Erfahrung in der Teamarbeit und denkst lösungsorientiert
    Du verfügst über ein gutes Verständnis von den relevanten technologischen und operativen Prozessen
    Gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse runden Dein Profil ab
    Beratung heißt Flexibilität: Dein Projekteinsatz richtet sich nach unseren Kunden und Deiner Projektsituation und beinhaltet sowohl hybrides Arbeiten als auch den Einsatz vor Ort

Das bieten wir [movers & shapers]

    Weiterbildung: umfangreiche fachliche und methodische Trainings inkl. Zertifizierungen sowie vielfältige Entwicklungsperspektiven innerhalb des Unternehmens
    Work-Life-Balance: Arbeitszeitkonto, hybrides und ortsflexibles Arbeiten innerhalb von Deutschland und bis zu 21 Tage pro Jahr in definierten EU-Ländern, Familienservice, Firmenfitness sowie die Möglichkeit zu einem Sabbatical
    Flexible Urlaubsgestaltung: 30 Tage Urlaub und die Möglichkeit zur individuellen Erhöhung oder Verringerung des jährlichen Urlaubs um bis zu 5 Tage
    IT-Equipment: Wir unterstützen Dich bei der Ausstattung von benötigtem Zusatz-Equipment für ein optimales ortsflexibles Arbeiten
    Selbst fahren: Firmenwagen und Dienstfahrrad per Gehaltsumwandlung
    Unser Beitrag: konzernweites Stipendienprogramm für junge Menschen in Indien und viele weitere Corporate-Responsibility-Projekte in den Bereichen Bildung, Beschäftigung und digitale Inklusion
    Unser Mindset: Teamspirit, offene Türen, Duzkultur, gelebte Vielfalt

title: Senior Full Stack Developer
description:
Grow with us – Start your career at IU now!

Seize this opportunity and support our team preferably in Berlin or Munich or at one of our locations or remotely across Germany, starting immediately in full-time as Senior Fullstack Engineer (m/f/d).

As a Senior Engineer at IU, you’re at the heart of our cross-functional product teams, steering the technical direction and execution of projects. Your primary focus lies in tackling complex technical challenges, utilising your advanced technical expertise to boost the team’s effectiveness. You will work closely with the Product Owner and Business Analyst to translate product requirements into effective technical solutions that hit our OKRs.

A significant portion of your role involves nurturing a culture of technical mentorship, conducting comprehensive code reviews, and upholding firm solutions. In line with IU’s customer-centric strategy, you’re instrumental in bringing maximum business value to our customers and fostering an atmosphere of continuous experimentation and learning within the team. Collaborating with the Head of Engineering in your cluster, you’ll make sure the team’s technical guidelines mesh with our broader tech strategy.

Your tasks

    Collaborate with the Product Owner and Business Analyst in your team to understand product requirements and translate them into robust, scalable solutions.
    Uphold high coding standards through conducting regular code reviews, ensuring the team’s output is consistently of top quality.
    Handle the most complex and critical issues within the team to deliver maximized business value.
    Promote a culture of delivering high-quality, customer-centric solutions, driving continuous experimentation and learning in the team.
    Provide technical mentorship to other team members, guiding them through complex problems, promoting their technical growth, and fostering a culture of continuous learning within the team.
    Provide feedback and guidance on improving coding practices within the team, addressing any code-related issues promptly and effectively.
    Ensure alignment of technical solutions with overall product strategy, maximizing the business value delivered to our customers.

Your Profile

    You have several years of experience in software development, with substantial time spent in a senior role.
    You possess a deep understanding of some of our technical stack, which includes Java 8, Symfony 6+ / Laravel with Modern PHP (v8+), NodeJS, NestJS, VueJS and TypeScript. Cloud-first approach with AWS. Understanding of Databases (SQL or No SQL) will be required. You have experience of modern software development methodologies and knowledge of Microservices, Domain Driven Design and Event-Driven Architectures is advantageous.
    Your knowledge of efficient software development methodologies and best practices is demonstrated, including their successful implementation.
    You have a solid understanding and practical experience with Agile methodologies and Lean practices.
    Your strong communication and collaboration skills enable effective interaction with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
    You are eager about continuous learning and have demonstrated the ability to foster technical excellence within the team.

We offer

    Shape your career: Rapid growth opens up many new opportunities for you. Tell us about your dream career and we’ll help you make it happen.
    Work from wherever you want …: Modern tools and video meetings make it possible: with IU, the boundaries between here and there blur. You want to work from abroad for a while? No problem thanks to our WorkFlex benefits.
    … and flexible time: It’s your job: We trust you and give you the greatest possible freedom to organize yourself.
    You have the choice: You are free to choose your equipment, because everyone has its own preferences when it comes to hardware.
    Take your knowledge to a new level: Benefit from a 100% discount on tuition fees for an IU combined degree in the tech sector and many other free training courses. There is always something new to learn.
    Get a good rest: we push ourselves every day to go above and beyond. But we also take the time to recharge our batteries: with 30 days of annual vacation for all employees and an additional day off on your birthday! Need some time off? How about a sabbatical?
    Reach your destination sustainably: Germanys 9 euro ticket is history, we got the DeutschlandTicket for 7 €. You prefer to travel by bike? Then a Jobrad (bike leasing) might be the right choice. We offer many environmentally conscious options to be mobile both professionally and privately.

Join our Team at Germany’s largest university with over 100,000 students! We are passionate, competitive, open to anything new – and we live to develop anything that makes our students’ digital education experience and our IU services better to achieve our vision “Everybody can access education to grow”.

Sounds like the perfect job for you? Then apply now!

If you have any further questions, please feel free to contact Nicole at nicole.teixeira@iu.org.

Words are followed by actions: We take our “Culture Of Everyone” very seriously and would like to take this opportunity to expressly point out that you are welcome to join us, regardless of your origin, religion, gender, age or sexual orientation. Even if you have a disability, our doors are wide open to you. We look forward to a diverse community here at IU!
skillList: java, symfony, laravel, php, node, nest, vue, typescript, aws, sql, nosql, microservices, ddd, eda

title: Senior Fullstack Engineer TypeScript
description:
Wenn Du Dich für diese Stelle bewirbst, hast Du die Möglichkeit, Deinen bevorzugten Standort aus den folgenden anzugeben: Remote Deutschland, Berlin, Hamburg, Köln, München


Are you passionate about full stack development? Then grow your career at IU International University of Applied Sciences and join us to play a key role in advancing the educational journey for more than 2¹⁷ learners around the globe. You will contribute to shaping our innovative student management system and platform technology.

Seize this opportunity and join our interdisciplinary team, starting immediately as Senior Fullstack Engineer (m/f/d). You can choose to work fully remote or from one of our locations (e.g. Munich, Berlin, Hamburg, etc.) within Germany.
Our Stack

    Technologies: Typescript, NestJS, Vue.js 3, Tailwind CSS, Vite, Kafka
    Tools: AWS, Docker, DataDog, GitLab
    Principles: DDD

Your tasks

    You will be part of our cross-functional team focusing on study management product domains or platform services and shared libraries.
    You will develop our high-performance event driven distributed system using microservices and microfrontends
    Collaborate with fellow engineers, product managers, UX, QA, DevOps …
    Monitor and troubleshoot the system, utilizing various tools and metrics to ensure high availability and performance.
    Develop and maintain up-to-date documentation, best practices and standards.

Your Profile

    You have expert knowledge in Typescript and Node.js (preferably NestJS).
    You are familiar with event driven architecture and already gained experience with event streaming platforms like Kafka or message brokers like RabbitMQ.
    You have working experience with cloud platforms (preferably AWS) and you are familiar with container technologies such as Docker or Kubernetes.
    You have a solid knowledge about web technologies and have a profound understanding of website performance, accessibility, semantics and code quality.
    You have sound experience in component development using modern web frameworks such as Vue, Svelte, SolidJS or React.
    You are enthusiastic about technical concepts and software architecture.
    You are a team player with good communication skills.
    You are characterized by an independent, goal-oriented and structured way of working.
    Embrace ownership of your projects while understanding their impact on the bigger picture

We offer you

    Shape your career: rapid growth opens up many new opportunities for you.
    Work from wherever you want: Modern tools and video meetings make it possible. Do you want to work from abroad for a while? No problem thanks to our WorkFlex benefits.
    …and when you want: It’s your job: We trust you and give you the greatest possible freedom to organize yourself.
    You are free to choose your equipment: Everyone has their own preferences when it comes to hardware.
    Take your knowledge to a new level: Benefit from a 100% discount on tuition fees for an IU combined degree in the tech sector and many other free training courses.
    Get a good rest: With 30 days of annual vacation and one additional day off on your birthday.

Join our engineering team at Germany’s largest university with over 140,000 students and over 4,000 employees from more than 87 nationalities! We are passionate, competitive, open to anything new – and we live to develop anything that makes our students’ digital education experience and our IU services better to achieve our vision “Everybody can access education to grow.”

Does this sound like the perfect job for you? Then apply now! If you have any further questions, feel free to contact Ronja at ronja.kaiser@iu.org.

Follow words with actions: We take our “Culture Of Everyone” very seriously and would like to take this opportunity to expressly point out that you are welcome to join us, regardless of your origin, religion, gender, age or sexual orientation. Even if you have a disability, our doors are wide open to you. We are looking forward to fostering diversity here at IU!
skillList: typescript, nestjs, vue, svelte, solidjs, react, tailwind, vite, kafka, aws, docker, datadog, gitlab, ddd, devops, rabbitmq

title: Web Entwickler
description:
Firmenprofil
Schonmal auf der Suche nach einer Immobilie zum Kauf oder zu Miete gewesen? Dann warst Du wahrscheinlich schon auf der Webseite unseres Partnerunternehmens. Als zentraler Anbieter für digitale Services entwickelt Dein zukünftiger Arbeitgeber Inhouse Software-Lösungen für den Immobilien-, Versicherungs- und Finanzbereich. Als Web-Entwickler baust Du Prototypen und MVP´s (Minimum Viable Product) bis zur Umsetzung in laufende Web-Anwendungen. Entwickelt wurde unter anderem bereits eine KI-basierte Chatbot Software. Trotz der 15-jährigen Firmengeschichte und über 500 Mitarbeitern erlebst Du ein Start-up Feeling mit Du-Kultur und ohne Dresscode. Bewerbe Dich noch heute als Web Entwickler React / Node.JS (m/w/d) wahlweise an einem der Standorte in Berlin, Münster, Stuttgart, Ulm, Bonn oder Hamburg.

Ratbacher GmbH - Wir sind eine der führenden IT Personalberatungen der DACH-Region. Unsere Vision? Wir bringen IT Spezialisten mit den attraktivsten Arbeitgebern zusammen. Seit über 15 Jahren motiviert uns diese verantwortungsvolle Aufgabe täglich zu Bestleistungen. Mit einem Netzwerk von über 4.000 Top-Unternehmen und bereits über 12.000 erfolgreichen Vermittlungen besitzen wir die nötige Expertise, Dir den Weg zum neuen Traumjob zu ebnen!
Ihre Schwerpunkte

    Aufbau einer Komponenten Bibliothek als Standard für viele weitere Inhouse Projekte
    Performante Implementierung der Komponenten und Design der Schnittstellen (REST-API)
    Entwicklung neuer Produkt-Features mittels JavaScript, React, Node.JS und Next.JS
    Sicherstellung des responsiven Designs und der Browserkompatibilität
    Qualitätssicherung durch automatisiertes Testing mit modernen Tools, wie z.B. Jest, Cypress uvm.

Ihre Benefits

    Es erwartet Dich ein attraktives Gehaltspaket bis 75.000 Euro pro Jahr im Fixum
    Zusätzlich erhältst Du einen variablen Bonus von bis zu 3.000 Euro und jährliche Gehaltserhöhungen
    Wenn es Deine private Situation erfordert, kannst Du Dich für ein Teilzeitmodell (ab 32 h/Woche) entscheiden
    Deine Arbeitszeiten kannst Du frei und flexibel zwischen 6 Uhr und 22 Uhr einteilen
    Bring Abwechslung in Deinen Arbeitsalltag und nutze die Möglichkeit, durch Workation im EU Ausland oder 3 Tage in der Woche aus dem Homeoffice zu arbeiten
    Bildungszeit = Arbeitszeit – 2 Stunden pro Woche kannst Du Dir Zeit für Weiterbildungen nehmen und Dich weiterentwickeln

Ihre Qualifikationen

    Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung in der Softwareentwicklung mit JavaScript/TypeScript und React
    Im Best Case hast Du bereits mit Node.JS, Next.JS und/oder Nest.JS gearbeitet
    Eine agile Entwicklungsumgebung entspricht Deiner Arbeitsweise – Du entwickelst bereits nach modernen Codestandards und hast eine Clean Code Mentalität

As Frontend Engineer (React) you will work on our core product and use your skills to ensure that high quality code is created using tools, peer reviews and coaching. You will work together with the product and design team to drive our SaaS platform.

Wen wir suchen

    Experienced in frontend development, architecture, or a generalist role, with +3 years experience

    Comfortable working in a collaborative environment, asking for help when needed
    High level of independence in your work

Was wir bieten

    Growth Mindset: Become part of an ambitious and motivated team in a rapidly growing climate tech startup – funded by leading VCs and business angels.
    Real Responsibility: Take on responsibility for your own task packages.
    Dynamic Organizational Structure: Optimize your work-life balance with a focus on flexible working hours, remote solutions, and work-life balance.
    Office in Berlin-Mitte: Our office is located near Weinbergspark in Berlin-Mitte.
    Equipment: You have the freedom to choose your own equipment (within a budget range).
    Annual Team Retreat: Let’s enjoy an annual retreat with the entire team.
    Mobility Package: Choose between a JobRad and Dance Bike for your mobility.
    Fitness Package: Choose between Urban Sports and Classpass for your fitness.
    Collegial and Familial Team: A collegial and familial team welcomes you, characterized by an open company culture.
    Part of the Energy Transition: Be a part of the energy transition and directly experience the impact of your daily work.

Nächste Schritte

    Please apply directly through our online application form
    Your person of contact will be Marius Seufzer (Founding Engineer at autarc)
    After we have screened your CV, we will get in touch with you
    The first two steps will be short 30 minutes video conferences via Google Meet
    Afterwards, as a final step, we will invite you for a face-to-face interview to our Berlin office.

Auf diese Stelle bewerben
Über uns
Mit autarc entwickeln wir das führende Betriebssystem (OS) für Wärmepumpen-Installateure. Wusstest Du, dass 25% der CO2-Emissionen in Europa durch das Heizen unserer Gebäude verursacht werden? Das Problem: Es gibt zu wenige Installateure, um den wachsenden Bedarf an Wärmepumpen zu decken. Deshalb haben wir es uns zur Aufgabe gemacht, die Abwicklung von Wärmepumpen-Projekten für Handwerker deutlich digitaler, effizienter und einfacher zu gestalten. Mit autarc verringern wir gezielt die Hürden, um Einfamilienhäuser und kleine Mehrfamilienhäuser in Europa zu dekarbonisieren. Wir unterstützen Installateure dabei, sicher und problemlos auf Wärmepumpen umzusteigen.

title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
Full Stack Engineer
Engineering · Fernarbeit

Full Stack Engineer - Remote in EU

 

We're seeking a Software Engineer to join our engineering team and assist in developing Infogram, a data visualization and infographics platform featuring an intuitive interface enabling users to create interactive charts, maps, graphs, and infographics.

Infogram is a widely used tool across various sectors, including businesses, education, journalism, and individuals, allowing them to present data and information in an engaging and understandable format.

 

Our tech stack revolves around JavaScript, HTML, CSS, React, TypeScript and we're enthusiastic about experimenting with and adopting the latest technologies. We test our code with PlayWright, build and deploy using CI/CD, work in cross-functional teams using Basecamp's Shape Up approach, and allocate time for code maintenance and improvements. If this sounds familiar or you would like to work in a fast-moving team, we'd love to connect with you!

 

Responsibilities:

    Develop new data visualization solutions and enhance existing functionality
    Work on AI-related initiatives
    Design and construct scalable architectures prioritizing performance and usability
    Participate in design and code reviews
    Communicate and collaborate with other team members to resolve the best solutions to difficult problems

 

Requirements:

    Strong product thinking mindset; Interest in solving user problems, not just implementing another task
    Proficiency in Node, React/JS/TS, and willingness to learn
    Comfort working within an existing codebase and developing new code
    Excellent problem-solving, design, and debugging skills
    Eagerness to learn and grow as a developer, and help colleagues

 

Benefits include a competitive salary, flexible time-off policy, paid parental leave, work-from-home flexibility, paid sabbatical leave, top-notch equipment, an inclusive culture, and more.

 

If you want to be part of a collaborative team and value the well-being of your colleagues, we'd love to hear from you! At Infogram, we embrace diversity in both our customer base and our workforce, welcoming people from all backgrounds to contribute their unique perspectives as we aim to revolutionize how individuals share knowledge, tell stories, and inspire action. If visual communication excites you and you thrive in a team environment while caring for others, we encourage you to apply.

    Responsible for the end-to-end management and maintenance of the cloud hosting environment

Who You Are:

    Have experience in frontend development with Javascript and modern frameworks, preferably React and other modern frameworks
    Have experience with distributed system design, deployment, and operations - preferably with AWS
    Experience spans both Fullstack backend and frontend engineeringAbility to write designs, tradeoffs and explanations for your ideas
    Ability to write clear, secure, and scalable code within a Java application stack
    A passion for product and feature development

Good understanding of user experience concepts and their application in developing an appealing user interfaceUnderstanding and experience with security fundamentals, role-based security, and familiarity using encryption keys and controls

#LI-AD1
Working at Flywheel
We are proud to offer all Flywheelers a competitive rewards package and unparalleled career growth opportunities and a supportive, fun and engaging culture.

    We have office hubs across the globe where team members can go to feel productive, inspired, and connected to others - team members go into Hub Offices 3x a week
    Flexible vacation time
    Great learning and development opportunities
    Benefits that help you live your best life
    Parental leave and benefits
    Volunteering opportunities
    If you’re looking to connect with teammates on a topic of inclusion and identity, chances are there’s an ERG for that.
    Learn more about us here: Life at Flywheel

The Interview Process:
Every role starts the same, an introductory call with someone from our Talent Acquisition team. We will be looking for company and values-fit as well as your professional experience; there may be some technical role-specific questions during this call.
 
Every role is different after the initial call, but you can expect to meet several people from the team 1:1 and there might be further skill assessments in the form of a Take Home Assignment/Case Study Presentation or Pair Programming/Live Coding exercise depending on the role. In your initial call, we will walk you through exactly what to expect the process to be.
Inclusive Workforce
At Flywheel, our goal is to create a culture where individuals of all backgrounds feel comfortable in bringing their authentic selves to work. We want all Flywheel people to feel included and truly empowered to contribute fully to our vision and goals.
 
Flywheel is an Equal Opportunity Employer and participates in E-Verify. Everyone who applies will receive fair consideration for employment. We do not discriminate based upon race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, gender identity, national origin, disability, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying.
 
If you have any accessibility requirements that would make you more comfortable during the application and interview process, please let us know at recruitment@flywheeldigital.com so that we can support you.
 
Please note, we do not accept unsolicited resumes from 3rd party Recruitment Firms. 
 
For more information about what data we collect and how we use it, please refer to our Privacy Policy.
 
IMPORTANT ALERT: Please beware of fraudulent job communications from individuals falsely claiming to be from Flywheel. We've identified fraudulent activity through social media and messaging services purporting to be from Flywheel requesting payments for job- and recruitment-related expenses. Flywheel never asks candidates for personal information such as bank account data or tax IDs nor payments via social media or chat-based applications. Report suspected fraud to local authorities immediately. To learn more, click here.

title: Frontend Engineer React
description:
This role requires you to translate our company and customer needs into functional and appealing applications that will be used by thousands of users daily. That means you need to have a keen eye for details and understanding of how the user experience will be, combined with knowledge of React and highly used applications. We are looking for an engineer with relevant experience with CXP platforms and B2B2C engagement and collaboration.

We love working with talented folks with no ego, super collaborative, eager & hungry. Major bonus points if you also bring design chops. It's totally ok if you're early in your career!

What You'll Do

    Work on different aspects of our user facing products and websites, including Inbox, Flow Builder, Customer dashboard and Bird.com, our Developer Portal.

    Keep our front-end code up to date using the latest best practices and tools.

    Work closely with a team of designers to make their designs come to life, and keep designs scalable and re-usable by keeping our shared component library up-to-date.

    Make sure our front-end code lives up to performance standards

    Stay up to date with the latest tools and libraries to benefit user experience, performance, and developer experience

    Work on products that thousands of people use everyday, sending millions of messages

What You'll Bring

    1-5 years experience in a relevant role.

    Knowledge of React, JavaScript and TypeScript, modern HTML and CSS

    Depending on your experience, you may have worked with modern APIs within web applications - most of our APIs are built with Golang and PHP, exposing REST or GraphQL interfaces. You might even touch their code from time to time.

    Product mindset is key here at Bird, and experience working in product-based companies will give you a distinct advantage.

    Debugging and investigative skills; you’re capable of finding the cause of an performance issues quickly

    Understanding of how the browser works: you’re capable of explaining it to a 5 year old version of you.

    Quality driven mindset, and experience with tools like Jest and Cypress would be a bonus.

    Experience with setting up frontend applications and its build infrastructure, using tools like Snowpack, Babel or Webpack would be a bonus.

    Knowledge of Git

    You enjoy hacking things together to create a proof of concept, but you’re very critical of the code you push to production

Typical interview process

After you apply, you will hear back from us within a few days. If there’s a fit, the full process is as follows: 

↳ [30 mins] Recruiter Screen

↳ [60 mins] Programming Skills

↳ [60 mins] Bar Raiser / Executive interview

#LI-JT1 #LI-REMOTE

What You’ll Gain

🏡Remote work environment: you’ll work from home or wherever you can focus best.  All Birds are required to work from their hired country.

💰Competitive Compensation

💻Latest MacBook and generous Home Office Budget to set you up for success

💅State-of-the-art branded gear

🥳Company-wide and team events - last editions in Marbella and Bangkok! 

✈️Temporary Working Abroad: 10 business days a year (in your timezone)

🌴Life Happens! We offer generous Parental, PTO, and Special Leave Policies. 

🃏Joker Day! Wellness day? Party time? 1 extra day off per year, no questions asked! 

🤯Learn from hundreds of the best minds in the business

💙Join a diverse team consisting of 60+ nationalities, working in over +50 countries

LIFTOFF! 🚀

Life at Bird

When joining Bird, you will work with some of the smartest, curious, and driven people you will ever meet. It’s rewarding, demanding, and exciting work, and you’ll do and learn more than you can imagine. Bird is a great fit for ambitious self-starters who have endless curiosity, work independently, and like to roll up their sleeves and get shit done!

title: Senior Frontend Engineer - React, NextJS
description:
Senior Frontend Engineer (React, NextJS) {m/w/d}
Permanent employee, Full-time · Berlin
Read job description in:
Your mission

Our Engineering team is responsible for the technical development of our digital learning platforms, allowing people to learn knowledge and learning content in the field of programming, data science and artificial intelligence interactively via the browser in a practical way.

As a Senior Frontend Engineer [m/f/d] you will work on the next generation of our learning platform, which is built on technologies like React, NextJS, Python and Django. In addition to our own StackFuel learning platform, the Engineering team also works on two projects for the German Federal Ministry of Education and Research, to promote data and programming skills in German society. With your knowledge, you will be contributing in creating an interactive learning experience to get people interested in digital skills.
Your profile

    You have at least 3 years of experience with modern frontend development. 
    You know how to develop frontend applications at scale and how to operate them reliably.
    You are familiar with React, ideally NextJS experience
    Your priorities include Responsive Design and Accessibility
    You have experience with using UI component frameworks, technologies like Material UI, Tailwind, Chakra UI, Storybook.
    You are familiar with automated quality assurance tools (e.g. CI/CD Pipelines, React Testing Library, Jest, Cypress or Playwright) and know how to use them effectively
    If you've had touch points with backend API development, particularly Python/Django, this would be an advantage
    If you are familiar with Docker or cloud technology, this would also be an advantage
    You like to work with other developers in a team and you also see it as your task to support your colleagues
    You are resident in Germany, with your excellent communication skills in English or German, you operate confidently in a multilingual team 

Wo are we?

We are StackFuel’s Engineering team: Brian, Christian, Dima, Elena, Gordon, Hans, Marion, Moritz, Tim and Tra. Together with Jonathan (Product Owner) and Munzer (UI/UX), we’re building StackFuel’s digital learning experiences as a cross-functional team.

We believe in life-long learning. We exchange new ideas on a regular basis and adjust our agile way-of-working to our needs as we move along. Learn and grow with us through our internal learning opportunities and a yearly learning & development budget.

Decide how you want to work, use the utilities that work best for you (Hardware: Lenovo ThinkPad/MacBook Pro; OS: Linux/MacOS/Windows; Code editor of your choice).

Our tech stack:

    JavaScript, TypeScript, React, NextJS and Chakra UI on the frontend
    Python, Django and Django Rest Framework on backend
    NPM (JavaScript) and Poetry (Python) for package management
    Jupyter Ecosystem (Notebooks, Hub, Lab)
    Hetzner Cloud, Ionos, Ansible, NewRelic
    Docker, GitLab, Jira, Confluence, Slack, MS-Teams

Interview Process

Our interview process is straight-forward. Here is what you can expect:

    Quick call with our recruiter Felix to get to know another and learn more about the role
    Meet and interview with the people you'll be working with on two more occasions
    No take-home coding challenges

Why us?

    You will have excellent prospects in an up-and-coming, fast-growing company in the Learning & Development sector that deals with future topics such as big data, artificial intelligence and innovative technologies on a daily basis
    We offer you regular training courses and workshops at the highest level as an integral part of your further training. You can complete our online training courses at any time and train yourself to become a data expert
    StackFuel pays an inflation adjustment. We will be happy to discuss this with you in an initial phone call
    You take on responsibility from day one and contribute your own ideas
    You will work in a highly motivated and smart team that is constantly growing
    With us, you will experience an open feedback culture, flexible organizational structure and communication at eye level
    You enjoy flexible working hours including mobile working and a completely new office in the Bergmannkiez in Berlin-Kreuzberg
    You decide which device you want to work with in the future. Apple or Windows, the choice is yours.
    Work where others go on vacation? Take advantage of our Workation scheme. You'll find out more in your first meeting
    Protect your back with our height-adjustable desks throughout the office

Apply for this job
About us
What if your work contributed to educating and changing the entire world? We dream of a world where professionals use data and AI to drive business and innovation. That's why every day we pursue the mission of closing the global skills gap in data and AI with certified personnel development.  
Since 2017, we have become the leading German online training provider in the field of data literacy, data science and AI. We support large corporations, SMEs and public authorities in mastering the digital transformation by providing employees and job seekers with hands-on training in data skills. Our solution? In the Data Lab, our innovative and cloud-based learning platform, we combine interactive lesson types such as videos, quizzes, real business cases, practical projects and coding challenges with real data sets and work together with experienced industry and data experts. Our online courses are flexible, certified and can be financed through government funding programs. All participants receive personal mentoring with advice, feedback and weekly group webinars. 
StackFuel is based in the Kreuzberg district of Berlin. Our growing team of more than 40 experts works daily to effectively and efficiently prepare professionals for future job roles. Leading large corporations such as Daimler, Telefónica, Deutsche Bahn and Axel Springer work with us and our solution has already won several prestigious awards such as the Learning Award and the HR Innovation Award. Data is our passion and at our core we're all data nerds. We are committed to spreading data-driven thinking and action around the world. If you want to make our world a little bit better, become part of our team!
  At StackFuel, we don't just accept that everyone is different - we celebrate this fact, support them, and our team and products are stronger and more successful because of this. We are proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace committed to sustainable action.
skillList: react, nextjs, accessibility, mui, tailwind, chakraui, storybook, cicd, reacttestinglibrary, jest, cypress, playwright, python, django, docker, cloud

title: TV Frontend Developer
description:
Lust darauf, die TV-Apps der Zukunft zu entwickeln?

Wir suchen ab sofort in Hamburg eine/n

TV Frontend Developer:in in Voll- / Teilzeit, hybrid (all gender)

Wir entwickeln und betreiben für namhafte Kunden (wie ZDF, ARD, Arte, RTL+, RedBull, DFL, Vodafone etc.) TV-Applikationen mit datenbasierten Innovationen für Live-Sport-Events – auf allen Endgeräte und treiben die Entwicklung mobiler Anwendungen für große Mediatheken für Android TV und iOS Clients voran. Wir unterstützen unsere nationalen und internationalen Kunden von der ersten Produktidee bis zum operativen Betrieb.

Das bedeutet für dich viel Abwechslung und die Auseinandersetzung mit den neuesten Technologien, denn unser Tech-Stack wechselt je nach Anforderung und Projekt.

Du bist nerdig genug, um die Herausforderung der digitalen Transformation des Fernsehens anzunehmen, und möchtest mit uns tief in die Welt des personalisierten TVs, HbbTVs, der Set-Top-Boxen und Mediatheken eintauchen.

Du passt hervorragend zu uns, wenn du auch in turbulentem Fahrwasser einen kühlen Kopf bewahrst, nicht untergehst, sondern deine Aufgaben fokussiert und gewissenhaft erledigst und dich erst zufriedengibst, wenn du das Problem gefunden, analysiert und gelöst hast.

Dabei hilft dir deine einschlägige Erfahrung in der professionellen Entwicklung und Umsetzung von Web- und Mobile-Frontends und dein neu erwachtes Interesse daran, mit uns innovative und exzellente TV-Lösungen umzusetzen.Trifft all das auf dich zu, dann komm zu uns!

Damit wirst du dich bei uns beschäftigen

    Gestaltung von optisch ansprechenden Frontends für Mobile – und Webanwendungen
    Umsetzung von Softwareprojekten für unterschiedlichste Plattformen wie HbbTV, Set-Top- Boxen, Connected-TV mittels HTML, CSS und JavaScript
    Unterstützung des SCRUM-Entwicklerteam im gesamten Softwareentwicklungsprozesses – von der Anforderungserfassung über die Implementierung bis hin zu Testing und Dokumentation
    Einarbeitung und Entwicklung für ergänzende Plattformen wie z.B. FireTV, Android TV oder AppleTV
    Konfrontation mit nicht alltäglichen Programmierproblemen und Erarbeitung von eigenen Lösungen mit Unterstützung deines Teams

Das gibt's von uns

    eine in eigenständigen Scrum-Teams organisierte Firma
    aktuelle Hard- und Software
    flexible, familienfreundliche Arbeitsgestaltung und flache Hierarchien
    hybrides Arbeiten, remote & onsite (bei uns im Büro)
    Zugang zu den neusten Technologien: Cognitive Services, Multi-Cloud-Services, Kubernetes, u.v.m.
    gemeinsame Events und spontane Grillaktionen in unserem Hof
    ein cooles Loftbüro mitten im Schanzenviertel in Hamburg
    frisches Obst & kühle Gertränke
    last but not least, nette Kollegen, die sich auf dich freuen

 Das hast du im Gepäck

    3-5 Jahre Erfahrung in der professionellen Entwicklung von Web-Frontends
    Kenntnisse in der agilen Softwareentwicklung sowie Begeisterung und Leidenschaft für innovative Technologien, aktuelle Web-Entwicklungen und funktionales UI-Design
    gute Kenntnisse in JavaScript, React JS, HTML 5, CSS3 / SCSS, Git (erste Erfahrungen mit TypeScript und flutter wären ein Plus aber kein Must-have)
    Gute Kommunikationsfähigkeit in Deutsch und Englisch in Wort und Schrift
    Lösungsorientiertes, eigeninitiatives und strukturiertes Arbeiten
    Das passende Mindset, um mit uns exzellente Lösungen zu entwickeln!

title: Senior Frontend Developer
description:
Company
keylight is a global subscription technology vendor founded in 2015, with offices in Berlin, Zurich, Belgrade, New York, and Singapore. The platform is the only user-centric, end-to-end solution on the market, streamlining recurring operations across commerce, sales, subscription management, billing automation, revenue and accounting automation, and advanced data analytics.

Culture
Our teams at keylight are committed to a calm work environment, where constructive communication is prioritized and challenges are faced with positivity and resilience. We value work-life integration, accountability, and continuous learning. Join us to be part of a team driven by a clear vision and purposeful innovations in technology.
Senior Frontend Developer
Responsibilities

    Develop reusable and modular frontend components using modern JavaScript frameworks such as React, Angular, or Vue.js.
    Implement responsive design principles to ensure seamless user experiences across desktop, tablet, and mobile devices.
    Optimize frontend performance and load times, identifying and addressing performance bottlenecks and optimizing code for scalability and maintainability.
    Stay up-to-date with frontend technologies and industry trends, incorporating new tools and techniques into frontend development workflows.
    Collaborate with backend developers to integrate frontend components with backend APIs and services.

Senior Frontend Developer
Qualifications

    3+ years in frontend development roles, with a strong portfolio demonstrating proficiency in building user-friendly and visually appealing web applications.
    Expertise in JS, TS, Angular, RxJS, HTML5, CSS3, and AWS.
    Experience with frontend build tools and package managers such as Webpack, npm, or Yarn.
    Strong understanding of responsive design principles and mobile-first development practices.
    Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, with a focus on delivering high-quality frontend solutions.

Profile
Who you are

    A passionate and continuous learner committed to delivering high-quality user experiences.
    Comfortable collaborating directly with senior management.
    Highly organized and detail-oriented, with the ability to manage multiple projects and priorities simultaneously.
    Adaptable, flexible, and a great communicator, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams.

keylight Benefits
What we offer

    Attractive compensation package and comprehensive benefits.
    Dynamic and calm work environment.
    Opportunities for professional development and upward mobility.
    Work with industry-leading subscription technology.

title: Senior Front-End Developer
description:
At elopage, we believe that passion can turn into a career for anyone! With our cloud-based SaaS platform solution, elopage.com, we offer an easy and efficient way for everyone to create and sell digital products and online courses. More than 55,000 people have already placed their trust in our expertise!

Our story began in 2015, and for the first five years, we grew organically, becoming a profitable company with a team of around 60 employees. Then, in September 2021, we raised $38 million in series A funding led by Target Global, with participation from Partech Ventures and Avid Ventures. Since then, we've doubled in size!

Our core values are crucial to our success:

    As One Tribe
    Customer-Obsessed
    Be Curious & Drive Change

Diversity & Inclusion

At elopage, we embrace our differences, as they are our greatest strength. We recognize that everyone has a unique perspective based on their experiences, identities, and thought processes, and we strive to create an inclusive environment for all. Discrimination based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability status, or any other aspect that makes you unique is not tolerated at elopage. We aim to make growth accessible to everyone!

Description

Our engineering department leads the development of scalable, user-centric software solutions, harnessing agile methodologies to deliver robust and intuitive products. With a focus on continuous improvement and seamless integration, we craft transformative tools that redefine the digital experience for our customers in the DACH-region, and beyond.


Responsibilities

    Development of the 'client-side' of web applications
    Architect and translate complex company and customer needs into advanced, interactive applications
    Drive the creation of highly user-friendly environments through superior coding practices
    Stay ahead of industry trends by exploring and integrating new digital technologies
    Expertly combine usability with sophisticated visual design
    Ensure a highly functional, scalable, and visually appealing digital environment
    Collaborate with other team members to meet project goals and deadlines
    Mentor junior developers and provide technical guidance to the team

Requirements

    Proven track record in building and maintaining web applications
    Strong portfolio showcasing a range of web development projects
    Advanced knowledge of React, including hooks and context API
    Proficient in state management libraries like Redux or MobX
    Experience with server-side rendering using Next.js
    Configuring and optimising Webpack for efficient builds and performance improvements
    Proficient in consuming and integrating RESTful APIs
    Expertise in HTML5, ensuring semantic structure and accessibility
    Ability to create complex layouts and components using best practices and patterns
    Strong command over ES6+ JavaScript features
    Strong experience with TypeScript
    Component library development with Storybook
    Writing modular and maintainable CSS using SCSS or CSS-in-JS libraries like styled-components
    Proficient in using browser developer tools (Chrome DevTools, Firefox Developer Tools).
    Experience with automated testing tools such as Jest, React-testing-library, Cypress, Playwright
    Understanding of CI/CD pipelines and deployment processes using tools like GitHub Actions, Jenkins, or CircleCI.
    Strong eye for design, ensuring visual appeal and user-friendly interfaces.
    Familiarity with tools like Google Analytics and Google Search Console for monitoring SEO performance


Benefits

    Paid Time Off - 30 vacation days
    A competitive salary
    A personal training & development budget of € 1,500 per year
    Responsibility and trust from day 1
    Individual coaching and further training to support you in your development
    A free BVG ticket
    Employee discounts at numerous companies (e.g. at the gym or in online stores)
    Pension Program with company match
    A culture of equity and Inclusion where you are appreciated for the person you are

title: Frontend Developer
description:
Frontend Developer (w/m/x)
Festanstellung, Vollzeit · Berlin
Wir sind DINA
Bei DINA treiben wir Innovation voran und formen die Zukunft der digitalen Produkterfahrung im industriellen Umfeld. Mit über 35 Jahren Erfahrung in der Elektrotechnikbranche und einem engagierten Blick auf adaptive und responsive Organisationsprinzipien, bieten wir unseren Mitarbeitern eine Plattform für Kreativität und persönliches Wachstum in einer agilen Arbeitsumgebung.
Wir suchen engagierte Frontend-Entwickler, die sowohl ihre technischen Fähigkeiten als auch ihre interpersonellen Kompetenzen in einem dynamischen Umfeld einbringen möchten. Wenn du leidenschaftlich bist, Herausforderungen als Gelegenheit siehst und immer nach Wachstum strebst, dann bist du bei DINA genau richtig!
Deine Aufgaben
Als Frontend Developer bei DINA wirst du:

    Innovative, skalierbare Frontend-Architekturen entwerfen und implementieren.
    Mit neusten Technologien wie Vue.js, TypeScript und MobX arbeiten, um intuitive und dynamische Benutzeroberflächen zu schaffen.
    Die Qualität der Software durch umfassende Tests (e2e, Integration, Unit) sicherstellen und kontinuierlich verbessern.
    Mit deiner Expertise bzw. Interesse an Design Systeme sowie Component Libraries, entwickelst du das Look & Feel der nächsten Generation von digitalen Produkten von DINA
    Eng mit einer Product-Ownerin, UX/UI-Designerin und Backend-Entwicklern zusammenarbeiten, um nahtlose und kohärente Produktfeatures zu entwickeln.
    Beständig neue Technologien erkunden und Vorschläge zur Verbesserung unserer Prozesse und Produkte einbringen.

Dein Profil

    Mindestens 6 Jahre Erfahrung in der Frontend-Entwicklung.
    Tiefgehende Kenntnisse in Frameworks wie Vue.js oder vergleichbare wie React oder SolidJS.
    Expertise in modernem JavaScript (ES6+), TypeScript, HTML, CSS und verwandten Frameworks.
    Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse und gute Englischkenntnisse.
    Erfahrungen mit e2e Testframeworks wie Playwright.
    Vertrautheit mit Tools zur UI/UX-Gestaltung wie Figma und Storybook.
    Kenntnisse im Bereich Cloud-Hosting, vorzugsweise AWS.

Unsere Benefits

    Ausgezeichnetes Arbeitsumfeld: Wir streben nach hoher Leistung und halten dabei immer die Balance mit Freundlichkeit und Fürsorge.
    Flexible Arbeitsumgebung und -zeiten: Durch Homeoffice und unser Gleitzeitmodell bieten wir flexible Arbeitszeiten, die es ermöglichen, Arbeit und Privatleben optimal zu kombinieren.
    30 Urlaubstage: Jedes Jahr stehen dir 30 Urlaubstage zur Verfügung, um dich zu erholen und neu zu motivieren.
    Kostenloser Teamlunch: Genieße jeden Tag einen gratis Teamlunch sowie Mitgliedschaften bei Urban-Sports-Club oder Gympass und die Möglichkeit eines Job-Rads.
    Kreatives und produktives Arbeitsklima: Wir fördern Kreativität und Produktivität durch ein spannungsbasiertes Arbeitsumfeld und eine holokratische Organisationsstruktur.
    Betriebsrente und Sabbaticals: Mit DINA-Care unterstützen wir deine finanzielle Zukunft und bieten Unterstützung bei der Planung von Sabbaticals.
    Einflussnahme und Wachstum: Nutze die Gelegenheit, einen bedeutenden Einfluss in einem schnell wachsenden Unternehmen zu haben, ohne in einem Startup zu arbeiten.
    Wertschätzung von Fähigkeiten: Wir suchen nach leidenschaftlichen Entwicklern, die wirklich daran interessiert sind, etwas Neues zu schaffen und schätzen sowohl harte als auch weiche Kompetenzen.
    ⚖️ Autonomie und ausgewogenes Tempo: Wir legen Wert auf Autonomie und das richtige Gleichgewicht zwischen Geschwindigkeit und Qualität.
    Attraktives Gehaltspaket: Wir bieten ein konkurrenzfähiges Gehaltspaket.
    Mentorship & Weiterbildung: Profitiere von einem Weiterbildungsbudget von 2000 Euro pro Jahr für deine persönliche und fachliche Entwicklung.

title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
At flaconi, we believe that diversity fuels creativity, innovation and growth. It thrives in all its forms of beauty. Our team is a mosaic of individuals from different backgrounds, cultures and life journeys, all united by a shared passion for beauty. Our commitment is grounded in our core values, particularly #trustinpeople. We hold ourselves accountable for creating an environment where every employee feels honestly valued, heard and empowered to contribute their unique perspectives to foster belonging.

Our engineering department is responsible for building up and steadily improving one of the most important components that make our business as successful as it is - our marketplace. Dive into our tech stack of ReactJS, Redux, Symphony, node.js, AWS Lambda, AWS SQS and SNS, Flutter (... and many more!) and support one of our 6 different cross-functional teams to make our product unique. Your Engineering Manager and the whole team are looking forward to mastering the challenges of the team together with you. We are looking forward to your application and will love to welcome you in our international team.
Your role

        Work collaboratively with Product, UX/UI Designers, and Engineers to contribute to the scoping, design, and implementation of user-facing features with moderate complexity.
        Implement product features that contribute to user engagement, experience, and potential monetization under the guidance of senior team members.
        Participate in the development cycle, including architectural design, implementation, testing, deployment, and maintenance, with supervision and support from senior team members.
        Take ownership of assigned tasks within the development cycle, including writing appropriate unit and integration tests, and deploying accepted features with guidance.
        Seek opportunities to learn and grow by participating in coaching sessions and seeking mentorship from senior engineers on best practices, frameworks, and frontend guidelines.
        Actively participate in product and feature discovery sessions with Product Managers, contributing ideas and insights within the scope of your expertise and experience.

Your Profile

        Minimum 3 years of hands-on experience with NodeJS, React, TypeScript,demonstrating proficiency in each technology, advanced PHP is a plus
        Proven experience with monitoring tools like Newrelic, Sentry or similar
        Familiarity with AWS services and solutions, with demonstrated exposure to deploying, managing, and optimizing applications
        Working experience with different levels of test automation - especially Unit tests (Jest, PHPUnit) or E2E tests (selenium)
        You own your individual code base, write appropriate unit and integration tests, and continuously deploy accepted features
        Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams and articulate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders

What we offer you

        Full transparency: For this role, we have a salary band between 60,000€ and 80,000€ per year. The salary that we will offer you will always be within this span and is based on the skills and experience that you show during the recruitment process.
        Our employees matter to us: We offer you a permanent contract and BVG ticket.
        Work-life balance: 29 vacation days, flexible working hours, up to three days of working from home a week and in specific cases the option to work 100 % remotely; the possibility of a paid sabbatical.
        flaconi Academy: Actively shape your own career path by taking advantage of our internal and external training opportunities.
        We care about your well being: We want to support you also during difficult times. For this, we offer you and your close relatives counseling sessions with mental health professionals.
        flaconi Fitness: a wide range of sports options & discounts on memberships.
        Family first: Our “emergency-daycare” is there for you in out-of-the-ordinary situations to look after your child on site at our office.
        Thinking about tomorrow together: flaconi subsidizes your savings contribution to the company pension scheme with an additional 20%.
        A comfortable working space with everything you need: High end technical equipment, fruits and drinks, no dress code and dogs are welcome in our office!
        Other perks: Great discounts in our online shop as well with our partner companies, cool team events & company parties!

About flaconi

flaconi is one of Germany’s leading online beauty retailers with an extensive portfolio of almost 1000 brands and 50.000 products. From drugstore over organic cosmetics to premium and luxury, the online shops in Germany, France, Austria and Poland cover all product segments and offers a diverse selection of products for a unique and daily beauty routine.

Founded in 2011 as one of the first online perfumeries, flaconi is honored to work with more than 700 people from 60 different nations at the flaconi headquarters in Berlin-Charlottenburg and its fulfillment center in Halle.

Shape our company’s success with us and apply now online! We look forward to receiving your complete application documents including your earliest starting date.
skillList: react, typescript, node, php, newrelic, sentry, aws, jest, seleniium

title: Senior Backend Engineer - TS/Node.js
description:
Introduction

At Omio, we are Making Travel Easy through Technology! This is a great chance for you to join one of Europe’s fastest growing travel companies, backed by over 30 million monthly users and the world’s leading tech investors.

We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer to join our Core Platform team. You'll be solving very relatable user problems and help build a truly outstanding product experience for travellers from all over the world while they're searching, comparing and booking their best journey.

You'll get to work on interesting complex projects within Core Platform, i.e. Authentication and Live Journey updates.
What you will do:

    Create robust scalable solutions using state-of-the-art technologies. You will support and build key components that are used throughout all of Omio (mobile, web apps)
    Work with your team to rapidly test ideas on users, use results for iterations and improve our product
    Test new languages, libraries and frameworks and evaluate their potential to make sure we never stop innovating. You will share best practices with other teams and help make those a company standard.
    Apply your engineering experience to automate processes and help to guide the team during the decision making 

Your profile

Our tech stack:

    Typescript, Node.js, React.js, ES6, Rest API/GraphQL , Styled components, Jest, Cypress, Docker, Kubernetes, GitHub 

:https://omio.tech/radar

You :

    Customer focused: You have a passion for building intuitive and scalable products that enhance our analytical capabilities and drill down to what works best for our customers
    Experienced and educated: You have a degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience and worked multiple years (3+ years) with production systems of high availability and high traffic
    Up to code: You have experience in software development, you write clean, lean, effective code in multiple languages, all version controlled. You pick the right tool for the job and are not limited to a single paradigm or language
    Pragmatic: You and your team take on complex multi-domain problems, analyse, design, build modular solutions, and deliver end-to-end in an MVP, value-first and iterative approach
    An automator: You remove repetition and snowflakes through scripting and automation tools. You have deployed, monitored, and supported applications across stacks and technologies
    You think big: A small, innocent application can always grow. You have ideas on how to distribute a system so that it can work at scale
    A team player: You guide and help your teammates with planning and delivering high quality software and also take on communication across teams 

Omio encourages you to apply even if you’re still developing some of
skills!What’s in it

    , Jenkins 

Check more details

for you? #LifeAtOmio

    Have an impact. With innovation and smart technology, together, we are powering journeys that move us.
    27 vacation days, a day off on your birthday, and more
    Travel Benefits Scheme
    A diverse team of more than 50 nationalities. 

Learn more about Omio:

    Our Story
    Medium Engineering Blog 

Here at Omio, we know that no two people are alike, and that’s a great thing. Diversity in culture, thought and background has been key to growing our product beyond borders to reach millions of users from all over the world. That’s why we believe in giving equal opportunity to all, regardless of race, gender, religion, sexual orientation, age or disability.
Hiring process and background checks
At Omio, we work in partnership with Giant Screening, once a job offer has been accepted, Giant will be engaged to carry out background screening. Giant will reach out to you via email and occasionally via telephone/text message so that they can gather all relevant information required. Consent will be requested prior to any information being passed to our

title: Senior Frontend Developer
description:
Deine Mission 🚀

    Du entwickelst mit React-Native eine hybride App für iOS und Android
    Du schreibst sauberen und wartbaren Code, der flexibel einsetzbar und erweiterbar ist
    Du drehst an den letzten Stellschrauben, um unseren Benutzer:innen eine reibungslose App-Erfahrung zu bieten
    Du denkst ganzheitlich und führst Design, fachliche Anforderungen, Tracking und andere Bereiche in der App zusammen

Deine magischen Kräfte 💫

    Du hast mehrere Jahre mit JavaScript gearbeitet und Frontends entwickelt
    Du hast bereits React und/oder React-Native und ggf. mit Redux Applikationen entwickelt
    Erfahrungen mit nativer Entwicklung für iOS oder Android wären schön, sind aber keine Voraussetzung
    Du erarbeitest dir ein fundiertes Verständnis für das Versicherungsgeschäft, setzt dich mit der Branche und ihren Verfahren auseinander und bringst diese Expertise in deinen Arbeitsalltag ein
    Du bist ein:e Teamspieler:in und arbeitest am Besten mit kleinen, interdisziplinären Teams
    Du bist pragmatisch und qualitätsgetrieben
    Du findest einfache Lösungen für komplexe Probleme
    Du bist neugierig auf neue Technologien und willst dich immer weiterentwickeln
    Du arbeitest eigenverantwortlich und kannst deine Ideen in die Tat umsetzen

Unser Versprechen ✅

    Finanzguru mitgestalten statt nur mitschwimmen: Aktive Mitarbeit an fachlichen und kulturellen Themen, die auch über den Tellerrand hinausgehen & die Tech-Community glücklich machen
    Ein Team bestehend aus wahren Gurus auf ihren Fachgebieten, flachen Hierarchien, Transparenz und Spaß bei als auch außerhalb der Arbeit
    Eigenverantwortung vom ersten Tag an, eine attraktive Vergütung sowie die berufliche Perspektive und die Möglichkeit, Dich in Deinem Aufgabenfeld (und darüber hinaus!) weiterzuentwickeln
    Die Möglichkeit aus dem Home Office heraus zu arbeiten
skillList: react, reactnative, redux

title: Fullstack Developer
description:
Jobbeschreibung

Du möchtest mit uns den digitalen Handel revolutionieren und mit deiner Arbeit dazu beitragen, dass Online-Shopping zu einem echten Erlebnis wird? Wir bei Shopware haben die Vision, Online-Händler:innen die Möglichkeit zu bieten, mit unserer Open-Source E-Commerce-Software eigene Online-Shops und herausragende Einkaufserlebnisse zu schaffen. 

Werde Teil eines interdisziplinären Teams, das direkt an unserer Commerce-Software „Shopware“ codet und überwiegend den Bereich "Checkout und Payment" verantwortet. Dabei spielt es keine Rolle von wo aus du arbeitest, ob vor Ort bei uns am Campus in Schöppingen oder Full-Remote in Deutschland oder einem anderen Land in Europa. Du bist immer ein fester Bestandteil unserer Shopware Crew.
Das sind deine Aufgaben:

    Du arbeitest in einem interdisziplinären Development Team, bestehend aus Engineers, Design und Qualitätssicherung, das hauptsächlich am Produktbereich "Checkout und Payment" codet.
    Du entwickelst und implementierst innovative Produktfeatures und Erweiterungen für unsere Open-Source E-Commerce Lösung "Shopware 6" auf der Basis von PHP (Symfony) und JavaScript/TypeScript (Vue.js).
    Du arbeitest auf der Basis agiler Entwicklungsmethoden (Scrum/Kanban), u.a. mit den Tools Jira und Confluence.
    Du unterstützt bei der Software-Dokumentation und innerhalb unserer Open-Source Development-Community.
    Du testest deine Software selbstständig (Unit/Functional/E2E) und führst Code-Reviews durch, um deine Softwarequalität stabiler und zuverlässiger zu machen.
    Du achtest bei deiner Arbeit auf Details bei der Umsetzung von Responsive Web Design und hast ein Auge für Cross-Browser-Kompatibilität, Barrierefreiheit und Performance.

Das bringst du mit:

    Du hast bereits drei Jahre Berufserfahrung als Software Developer (m/w/d) gesammelt und mit PHP und JavaScript (oder TypeScript) gearbeitet. 
    Du hast Lust überwiegend "Fullstack" zu arbeiten und gleichermaßen am Frontend und Backend zu coden. 
    Du hast ein Grundverständnis für Qualitätssicherung und Code-Reviews.
    Du bist bereit 1-2 mal pro Monat an unserem Campus in Schöppingen (Nähe Münster) mit dem Team zusammenzukommen. 
    Du traust dich täglich Englisch zu sprechen und in einem internationalen Umfeld mit einem „English First“ Ansatz zu arbeiten.

Das bieten wir dir:

    Flexible Arbeitszeiten
    Ortsunabhängiges Arbeiten im Rahmen von Mobile Work und Full-Remote Verträgen
    Wahl deiner Hardware
    Fundiertes Onboarding mit deinem persönlichen Buddy
    Crew-Love
    Persönliches Wachstum & Fortbildungen
    Teamevents
    ... und vieles mehr!

Einen detaillierten Einblick bekommst du auf unserer Karriereseite
skillList: php, symfony, vue, typescript, testing

title: Full stack engineer
description:
In short

As a Full Stack Engineer within our Experimentation Platform Team, you'll play a pivotal role in shaping the future of our products and services through robust AB testing setups and optimization strategies. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and maintain the experimentation platform that drives our decision-making process. Your expertise will be instrumental in building scalable, reliable, and user-friendly solutions to enable seamless AB testing across various products and features.
Your Mission

    Design and implement robust AB testing frameworks and infrastructure to support experimentation across web and mobile platforms
    Collaborate with frontend developers to integrate experimentation features seamlessly into user interfaces
    Continuously optimize experimentation processes and workflows to improve efficiency and reliability
    Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and best practices in AB testing and experimentation
    Collaborate with product managers, designers, and other stakeholders to define experimentation goals and requirements
    Participate in code reviews, knowledge sharing sessions, and cross-functional meetings to foster a culture of collaboration and learning

title: Full Stack Software Engineer
description:
Full Stack Software Engineer (Javascript/ Typescript)

We are currently staffing a Senior Fullstack Engineer role @ a well-funded eCommerce AI startup for visitor churn prevention.

You will join their team of ~10 software engineers to optimise and develop the next generation of their product.

You should have at least five years of experience with JavaScript /TypeScript and Node.js. Sound knowledge of software architecture principles, GCP, and Kubernetes and experience working in startup environments will be additionally helpful to succeed in this role.

MongoDB experience would be nice, but it is optional.

| REMOTE WORK POLICY

This role is fully remote within Europe (+/- 3 hrs from CET).

| WHAT YOU WILL GET

* Develop an innovative AI product which helps to improve E-Commerce solutions significantly

* Work with a fast-growing, super-agile team with exceptional drive, commitment & flat hierarchies

* Salary of 80-90k€ / year (negotiable in selected cases)

* Fully remote setup with lots of personal flexibility

* Unlimited workation opportunities anywhere in the world as long as you do a good job

| NEXT STEPS

If you are interested in this role, we will share additional information about the company and role to support your decision-making process and invite you to a first chat with the head of engineering.

    0 - Software Engineering 
Role
    Full-Stack Engineer 
Locations
    Berlin 
Remote status
    Fully Remote 
Employment type
    Full-time 
Relocation / Visa Support
    true

DL Remote is a talent network for remote-ready or relocation-supported jobs at outstanding companies. We help you find a good match.

title: Backend Javascript / Node.js Developer
description:
Who we are
We are a Social Media Software as a Service scaleup from Ingolstadt. SocialHub has positioned itself as a remote-first company and achieved the title of OMR market leader in 2023. Our 90-person team is made up of creative personalities and 22 countries. All of us have our own rhythm, but we share the philosophy: "We believe that work should be fun."

So far, we have engineered a smart software used daily by major Social Media Teams in Germany and Europe. If you are looking for a job in an established (but still growing) SaaS startup and you love to build software that’s both fun and easy to use, this could be it!
#WORKHAPPIER: Our Benefits for you

    4-day week: first Friday of the month is free - "Your day to design a better life"
    Remote work: choose your feel-good workspace - whether from home or in a café
    36h week in Q3: early start to the weekend, Fridays are over from 1 pm or after 4 hours of work!
    Company team event: once a year we go on a team building holiday together - 2024 Tuscany!
    Company House 2024: free holiday home in Europe for teamwork or holidays with partner/family!
    Training budget, Kindle incl. book flat rate and much more

Your tasks

    You like writing automated tests so you notice regressions on your code early on
    You love to see your users happy. Therefore you don’t hesitate to help clients if the need arises for solving bugs.
    Using a DVCS like git comes natural to you
    You appreciate constructive criticism and are able to provide such yourself when reviewing others code
    You have a thing for documenting your work because you know your future self will appreciate it

Your requirements for the job

    At least 3 years working experience in a development team and experience in developing scalable web apps
    Experience in building Node.js based APIs with Express.JS
    Knowledge of common web security best practices (e.g. OWASP 10)
    You are able to work and communicate with your teammates through our core hours (11am to 4pm german timezone)

Nice to have

    You have experience with technologies like Redis, RabbitMQ and the ELK stack
    Experience with non-relational databases
    Knowledge of mongodb and its query syntax
    You can analyze and resolve performance issues with mongodb queries and indices
    You’ve worked with gitlab and gitlab ci before
    Knowledge of the Social Network API’s e.g. Facebook, Twitter, etc.
    You’ve run your own Web Server in the past and know your way around Linux

Auf diese Stelle bewerben
About us
We want you to love what you do. Our goal is to create an environment that makes you feel happy, challenged and motivated. With us, your skills count, regardless of gender, background, location or age. You don't have to explain every step - we give you the freedom to be creative and innovative. We are looking for talent and have full confidence in our employees.
skillList: testing, node, express, rest, owasp10, redis, rabbitmq, elk, mongodb, gitlab, gitlabci, linuxadmin

title: Senior Frontend Developer
description:
(Senior) Frontend Developer – Berlin / Remote (w/m/d)

⌚ Vollzeit oder Teilzeit

🏠 Berlin oder remote
Finanzfluss – Wir machen Menschen zu finanziellen Selbstentscheidern.

Wir glauben, dass Geld gut ist. Du auch? Dann werde Teil unserer Community. Diese besteht aus finanzinteressierten Menschen und erreicht jeden Monat über unsere Website, Social Media, den Newsletter und Podcast ein Millionenpublikum. Zusammen mit unserer Community entstehen ständig neue Ideen, die wir mit großer Freude umsetzen.

Unsere Mission ist es, Menschen das erforderliche Wissen einfach zugänglich zu machen und sie damit zu ermutigen, ihre finanzielle Zukunft aktiv selbst zu gestalten.
Dein Impact

Du hilfst uns, unsere ambitionierte Tech-Roadmap für 2024 (und darüber hinaus) umzusetzen, damit mehr Menschen in unserer Community ihre finanziellen Ziele erreichen können.
Deine Aufgaben

    Du unterstützt unser Tech-Team bei der Weiterentwicklung unserer Web-Applikationen (Editorial Content, Vergleiche von Finanzprodukten, ETF Suche, Copilot)
    Du bringst deine „State of the Art“ Best Practices zu Frontend-Entwicklung, Accessibility, Web Performance & Testing in unser Team ein

Deine Skills

    Du bist Expertin oder Experte in moderner TypeScript Front-End Entwicklung (das Front-End unserer Website ist mit Vue / Nuxt gebaut und das Front-End unseres Copiloten in Vanilla React)
    Du weißt, wie man komplexe Apps sowohl auf Komponenten-Basis als auch E2E testet
    Als gute Teamplayerin oder guter Teamplayer beherrschst du eine klare Kommunikation, du bist zuverlässig und deine Ergebnisse sind planbar
    Optional: Du hast Erfahrung im Aufsetzen von zuverlässigen CI/CD Pipelines und dem Monitoring von produktiven Anwendungen

Wir bieten dir

    Einen unbefristeten Arbeitsvertrag mit einem kompetitiven Vergütungspaket
    Über unser Mitarbeiterbeteiligungsprogramm (VSOP) partizipierst du an unserem Unternehmenserfolg
    Weiterentwicklungsmöglichkeiten in einem stark wachsenden und profitablen Start-up
    Ein modernes Büro mit Home-Office Flexibilität

title: Senior Front-End Developer
description:
At elopage, we believe that passion can turn into a career for anyone! With our cloud-based SaaS platform solution, elopage.com, we offer an easy and efficient way for everyone to create and sell digital products and online courses. More than 55,000 people have already placed their trust in our expertise!

Our story began in 2015, and for the first five years, we grew organically, becoming a profitable company with a team of around 60 employees. Then, in September 2021, we raised $38 million in series A funding led by Target Global, with participation from Partech Ventures and Avid Ventures. Since then, we've doubled in size!

Our core values are crucial to our success:

    As One Tribe
    Customer-Obsessed
    Be Curious & Drive Change

Diversity & Inclusion

At elopage, we embrace our differences, as they are our greatest strength. We recognize that everyone has a unique perspective based on their experiences, identities, and thought processes, and we strive to create an inclusive environment for all. Discrimination based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability status, or any other aspect that makes you unique is not tolerated at elopage. We aim to make growth accessible to everyone!

Description

Our engineering department leads the development of scalable, user-centric software solutions, harnessing agile methodologies to deliver robust and intuitive products. With a focus on continuous improvement and seamless integration, we craft transformative tools that redefine the digital experience for our customers in the DACH-region, and beyond.


Responsibilities

    Development of the 'client-side' of web applications
    Architect and translate complex company and customer needs into advanced, interactive applications
    Drive the creation of highly user-friendly environments through superior coding practices
    Stay ahead of industry trends by exploring and integrating new digital technologies
    Expertly combine usability with sophisticated visual design
    Ensure a highly functional, scalable, and visually appealing digital environment
    Collaborate with other team members to meet project goals and deadlines
    Mentor junior developers and provide technical guidance to the team

Requirements

    Proven track record in building and maintaining web applications
    Strong portfolio showcasing a range of web development projects
    Advanced knowledge of React, including hooks and context API
    Proficient in state management libraries like Redux or MobX
    Experience with server-side rendering using Next.js
    Configuring and optimising Webpack for efficient builds and performance improvements
    Proficient in consuming and integrating RESTful APIs
    Expertise in HTML5, ensuring semantic structure and accessibility
    Ability to create complex layouts and components using best practices and patterns
    Strong command over ES6+ JavaScript features
    Strong experience with TypeScript
    Component library development with Storybook
    Writing modular and maintainable CSS using SCSS or CSS-in-JS libraries like styled-components
    Proficient in using browser developer tools (Chrome DevTools, Firefox Developer Tools).
    Experience with automated testing tools such as Jest, React-testing-library, Cypress, Playwright
    Understanding of CI/CD pipelines and deployment processes using tools like GitHub Actions, Jenkins, or CircleCI.
    Strong eye for design, ensuring visual appeal and user-friendly interfaces.
    Familiarity with tools like Google Analytics and Google Search Console for monitoring SEO performance


Benefits

    Paid Time Off - 30 vacation days
    A competitive salary
    A personal training & development budget of € 1,500 per year
    Responsibility and trust from day 1
    Individual coaching and further training to support you in your development
    A free BVG ticket
    Employee discounts at numerous companies (e.g. at the gym or in online stores)
    Pension Program with company match
    A culture of equity and Inclusion where you are appreciated for the person you are
skillList: react, nextjs, typescript, redux, mobx, webpack, rest, storybook, sass, styledcomponents, jest, reacttestinglibrary, cypress, playwright, cicd, githubactions, jenkins, circleci, seo

title: Frontend-Entwicklung
description:
Vollständige Stellenbeschreibung
Ab sofort suchen wir für unseren Hauptsitz in Berlin drei erfahrene Mitarbeiter für die JavaScript- / TypeScript-Entwicklung in Vollzeit oder Teilzeit.

Wir möchten insbesondere Frauen dazu ermutigen, sich bei uns zu bewerben.

Aufgaben

    Mitarbeit an der Weiterentwicklung von Projektron BCS in einem unserer drei SCRUM-Teams
    Erarbeitung und Umsetzung von Umsetzungskonzepten für Erweiterungen und Änderungen in BCS
    Testabdeckung
    Unterstützung unseres Second-Level Supports bei der Lösungssuche von kundenspezifischen Wünschen sowie bei der Konfiguration von BCS oder der Anbindung externer Systeme

Qualifikation

    Gut abgeschlossenes Informatik-Studium oder ein gleichwertiges Studium aus dem MINT-Bereich
    Hervorragende Programmierkenntnisse in JavaScript und/oder TypeScript
    2 Jahre Berufserfahrung in einem ähnlichen Aufgabenumfeld
    Kenntnisse in mindestens zwei der folgenden Bereiche:

1. Webtechnologien (HTML5, CSS etc.)
2. Java
3. Progressive Web Apps (PWA)
4. Automatisiertes Testen
5. Web Services (REST)
6. UX
7. Buildtools wie Jenkins, Gradle, Webpack
8. Frameworks wie React, React Query, d3.js
9. Domain Driven Design

    Gute Deutschkenntnisse (B1 oder höher)

Benefits

    Work-Life-Balance: flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle, 30 Tage Urlaub, Sabbatical, mobiles Arbeiten & Workation
    Familienfreundlich: Familienbeauftragte, bezahlte Kind-krank-Tage, Familientag, Betreuungstage bei kranken Angehörigen
    Moderne Büros: Sitz-Steh-Tische, helle und ruhige Räume, ergonomische Arbeitsplätze
    Flache Hierarchien & offene Kommunikationskultur: kurze Entscheidungswege, agiles Arbeiten, Einarbeitung inkl. Mentoring-Programm, Chancengleichheit
    Mitarbeiter-Events: Vorträge und Workshops, Spieleabend, Basteln, Mitarbeitertreffen, Grillen auf der Dachterrasse
    Sport & Gesundheit: Kickerliga, Tischtennis, Yoga, Zahnzusatzversicherung, Fahrradkeller, Lauftrainings, Duschen, Urban Sports Club, JobRad-Leasing
    Weitere Vorteile: ÖPNV-Firmen-Ticket, bAV & BU, gemeinsamer Essensbereich, Müsli-Bar, Bio-Obst und -Getränke
    Individuelle jährliche Weiterbildungen

Die Projektron GmbH bietet zukunftsweisende, an Chancengleichheit orientierte Personalpolitik, die mit dem BestPersZertifikat, dem BestPersAward, dem TOTAL-E-QUALITY-Prädikat dem Preis Unternehmen für Familie sowie von Great Place to Work ausgezeichnet ist. Wir setzen uns für Chancengleichheit im Beruf ein und ermuntern Frauen, sich zu bewerben.
