title: Full Stack Software Developer
description:
Als IT-Systemhaus der Bundeswehr und IT-Dienstleister des Bundes bieten wir umfassende IT-Services aus einer Hand. Mit über 7.000 Mitarbeiter*innen zählen wir zu den zehn größten IT-Service-Providern Deutschlands. Wir suchen authentische IT-Liebhaber*innen, die ihre Leidenschaft mit uns teilen wollen, auf der Suche nach anspruchsvollen IT-Herausforderungen sind und Deutschlands IT gestalten möchten.

Sorgen Sie gemeinsam mit uns für die digitale Zukunftsfähigkeit unseres Landes.
Full Stack Software Developer (m/w/d)

ab sofort und in Vollzeit in Bonn, alternativ bundesweit an einem unserer BWI Standorte, Home Office möglich.

Für unsere neue Software-Engineering-Einheit suchen wir kreative und erfahrene Full-Stack-Entwickler*innen im Bereich C# und TypeScript, die ihre Fähigkeiten und Expertise in unser Team einbringen wollen.

In unserem Team gestalten und entwickeln wir professionell wirkungsvolle Softwareprodukte für Deutschland unter Verwendung moderner Technologien und Methodik. In agilen DevOps Teams leben wir Continuous Life, z.B. in dem wir den Automatisierungsgrad unserer Arbeit fortlaufend erhöhen und uns Themen wie Cloudification, IoT oder Artificial Intelligence widmen. Dadurch beschleunigen wir die digitale Transformation und Souveränität und sorgen gemeinsam für die digitale Zukunftsfähigkeit unseres Landes.

Belebe Deine Berufung neu - mit uns!
Ihre Aufgaben:

    Neuentwicklung einer Webanwendung im Bereich „Alarmwesen der Bundeswehr“, Frontend- und Backend

    Objektorientierter Entwurf, Implementierung und Continuous Integration & Delivery von Software-Modulen (Web Services, Komponenten, Applikationselemente) über alle Architekturebenen

    Übernahme von Entwicklungsaufgaben im gesamten Software Lifecycle in Cross-funktionalen Teams sowie die Durchführung von Code Reviews

    Generierung, Analyse und Abstimmung von Anforderungsspezifikationen und Geschäftsprozessen

    Impulsgebung zur Optimierung der Art und Weise der Zusammenarbeit im Team und mit allen Stakeholdern

    Durchführung der Integration in die Systemlandschaft der BWI und/oder deren Kunden

Ihr Profil:

    ​Abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium der Informatik oder vergleichbar in Kombination mit mindestens 4 Jahren einschlägiger Berufserfahrung im Bereich Software Engineering (z.B. SW Design & Architektur, Middleware, User Experience / Interface Engineering) nach Abschluss des Studiums

    Sehr gute Kenntnisse in der Backend-Entwicklung mit C# / .NET Core und Entity Framework sowie Datenbanksystemen, insbesondere MS SQL

    Sehr gute Kenntnisse in der Frontend-Entwicklung mit TypeScript, React und CSS

    Routine in den Standards professioneller Softwareentwicklung (Clean Code, Design Patterns, Architektur etc.) sowie mit GitLab und Confluence/Jira

    Kenntnisse in den Testframeworks TestCafe, Jest, xUnit wünschenswert

    Kundenorientiertes Arbeiten sowie Begeisterung für die enge Zusammenarbeit in einem agilen Team

    Verhandlungssichere Englisch- und Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift

Wir bieten:

    Mobiles Arbeiten ist möglich, alternativ kann alternierende oder heimbasierte Telearbeit mit Ausstattung des Heimarbeitsplatzes beantragt werden
    Durch abwechslungsreiche und gesellschaftlich relevante Aufgaben gewährleisten wir die IT-Sicherheit und Zukunftsfähigkeit Deutschlands
    Als primärer Digitalisierungspartner der Bundeswehr befähigen und unterstützen wir in Frieden, Krise und Krieg
    Die BWI bietet eine marktgerechte Vergütung, einen sicheren Arbeitsplatz sowie eine prämierte und arbeitgeberfinanzierte betriebliche Altersvorsorge
    Sie starten grundsätzlich mit 30 Tagen Jahresurlaub mit Option auf individuelle Anpassungen
    Wir ermöglichen Ihnen Flexibilität, um Beruf und Privatleben in Einklang zu bringen
    Sie erhalten ein individuelles Weiterbildungsbudget sowie einen kostenfreien Zugriff auf LinkedIn Learning und die Angebote der BWI-Academy
    Wir stellen Ihnen ein modernes Notebook (HP EliteBook) und ein High-End Smartphone (Samsung oder Apple) zur Verfügung
    Sie können ihr Wunschfahrrad leasen und über eine Bruttogehaltsumwandlung vergünstigt abrechnen
skillList: csharp, dotnetcore, entityframework, mssql, typescript, react, gitlab, cleancode, testcafe, jest, xunit

title: Senior Backend Engineer
description:
Introduction

At Omio, we are Making Travel Easy through Technology! This is a great chance for you to join one of Europe’s fastest growing travel companies, backed by over 30 million monthly users and the world’s leading tech investors.

We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer to join our Core Platform team. You'll be solving very relatable user problems and help build a truly outstanding product experience for travellers from all over the world while they're searching, comparing and booking their best journey.

You'll get to work on interesting complex projects within Core Platform, i.e. Authentication and Live Journey updates.
What you will do:

    Create robust scalable solutions using state-of-the-art technologies. You will support and build key components that are used throughout all of Omio (mobile, web apps)
    Work with your team to rapidly test ideas on users, use results for iterations and improve our product
    Test new languages, libraries and frameworks and evaluate their potential to make sure we never stop innovating. You will share best practices with other teams and help make those a company standard.
    Apply your engineering experience to automate processes and help to guide the team during the decision making 

Your profile

Our tech stack:

    Typescript, Node.js, React.js, ES6, Rest API/GraphQL , Styled components, Jest, Cypress, Docker, Kubernetes, GitHub

title: Senior Webentwickler Frontend
description:
Onlineprinters ist eine der marktführenden Onlinedruckereien Europas. Wir verkaufen als E-Commerce-Unternehmen Drucksachen online an B2B-Kunden in mehr als 30 europäischen Ländern. Unser Headquarter ist in Fürth, mitten in der Metropolregion Nürnberg. Zur Unternehmensgruppe mit mehr als 1.500 Mitarbeitern gehören zudem unsere Produktionsstandorte in Neustadt an der Aisch und Waldbüttelbrunn sowie weitere Onlinedruckereien in UK und Skandinavien. Werde Teil unseres Teams und sichere Dir einen Arbeitsplatz in einem erfolgreichen, stark wachsenden Unternehmen! Wir suchen Dich zur Verstärkung als
 
Senior Webentwickler Frontend (m/w/d)
 
Was Dich bei uns erwartet:

    Konzeption, Prototyping und Entwicklung moderner, reaktiver Frontends sowohl für unsere Webshops als auch für interne Software-Applikationen
    Zielgerichtete und strukturierte Entwicklung und Umsetzung anspruchsvoller Designs sowie technischer Features unter Berücksichtigung der Usability und technischer Machbarkeit

    Interdisziplinäre Zusammenarbeit und aktiver Wissensaustausch mit den Teams aus Marketing, UX und Produktmanagement

Was wir uns von Dir wünschen:

    Darüber hinaus hast du bereits mehrjährige Berufserfahrung im Bereich Frontend‐Engineering im E-Commerce-Umfeld

    Sehr gute Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse


Was wir Dir bieten:

    30 Tage Urlaub
    Offene Kommunikationswege, flache Hierarchien
    Einen attraktiven Arbeitsplatz in unserem modernen Headquarter
    Flexible Arbeitszeiten, Möglichkeit der mobilen Arbeit
    Sichere Perspektiven mit spannenden Projekten
    Firmenparkplätze direkt am Headquarter
    Einen bunten Strauß an Sozialleistungen (Corporate Benefits, Business Bike Leasing, VGN-Firmenabo, etc.)


Du hast Lust bekommen, an unserer Erfolgsstory mitzuwirken? Wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung!

title: Senior Frontend Engineer
description:
Your Responsibilities

As an experienced Frontend Engineer:

    you will be delighting the customer by working on our customer-facing platform as well as building the internal tooling for Raisin’s operations teams
    Together with your team you will own the design, implementation, and deployment of our applications
    Part of your responsibilities will be guiding features from their implementation through to testing, refinement, and finally launch
    Working closely with our product UX team to find practical and efficient solutions to complex problems is also part of your responsibilities
    You are actively participating in an agile and collaborative process in a cross-functional team with end-to-end ownership
    Finally, you are responsible for continuously improving your team as well as yourself

Your Profile

    University degree in Computer Science or related fields or equivalent practical experience
    You have been working as a professional Frontend Engineer
    You have strong experience with React or similar Frameworks / Libraries
    Experience with Next.js, Static Site Generators, the JAM-Stack and (headless-) Content Management Systems is a plus
    You are comfortable participating in technical and architectural discussions
    You are an open-minded and creative team player willing to continue creating our culture
    Great English communication skills

Join our mission, join our team - and grow with us!

At Raisin, we care about each other and it is one of our top priorities to foster an open and caring environment in which everyone feels welcome and comfortable. Our culture is strongly driven by our ambitious team, which, connects more than 40 different nationalities.

You'll find us in our modern and open office in the trendy Kreuzberg district with a view of the Spree River, ideally connected to public transportation and surrounded by a variety of restaurants and shopping opportunities.

As part of our team, you will benefit from:

    Personal training budget of 1,700 € and four full training days per year
    Free choice of hardware.
    Hungry all the time? Snacks, daily fresh fruit as well as drinks provided at the office.
    Flexible working hours, home office and 28 vacation days.
    Enjoy more than 50+ different sports with Urban Sports Club: We subsidize your membership with more than €20 per month.
    A company pension scheme (Betriebliche Altersvorsorge), which we support with 20%.
    Enjoy yearly company retreats to exciting European cities and other team events, such as Lunch & Learn, Tech Lunch, Female Empowerment Forum, CEO Talks as well as our yearly Summer- and Christmas Party.
    Do you miss being in the office? The corporate ticket gets you there, which we subsidize with €25 per month (BVG Firmenticket for Berlin and HVV ProfiTicket for HH).
    You are moving from another country or city to join us? We will support your relocation.

title: Frontend Developer
description:
Für unseren Geschäftsbereich Tax & Legal Solutions suchen wir dich zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt als Frontend Developer (w/m/d).

 
Das erwartet dich

Frontend – Du konzipierst, entwickelst und setzt benutzerfreundliche Frontend-Anwendungen im Bereich Tax & Legal Digital um. Dabei arbeitest du eng mit Designer:innen und Backend-Entwickler:innen zusammen, um eine nahtlose Integration von User Interface und Funktionalität sicherzustellen.

Softwareentwicklung – Als Teil eines crossfunktionalen Teams arbeitest du bei uns in agilen Entwicklungsprozessen und trägst zur kontinuierlichen Verbesserung unserer Entwicklungspraktiken bei. Code-Reviews sowie die Einhaltung von Coding-Standards und Best Practices sind zentrale Prinzipien unserer Arbeit.

Expertise – „Dienst nach Vorschrift“ ist dir fremd. Du schaust über den Tellerrand, informierst dich über neue Trends und bringst deine Ideen proaktiv in die Projekte ein - vom Büro oder zu Hause aus, wir sind flexibel!

Innovation – Du möchtest innovative Konzepte für digitale Lösungen in einem breitaufgestellten Team vorantreiben und deine volle Kreativität bei der Lösungsfindung nutzen? Dann hilf uns dabei, die Steuer- und Rechtsberatung in die digitale Zukunft zu führen. 

 
Das bringst du mit

    Ein Studium der (Medien-) Informatik, eines anderen MINT-Fachs oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung hast du erfolgreich abgeschlossen. Alternativ verfügst du über eine mehrjährige Berufserfahrung als Softwareentwickler:in.

    Du hast bereits (mehrjährige) praktische Erfahrung in der Entwicklung mit TypeScript/JavaScript und einem der gängigen Frontend-Frameworks wie Angular, React oder Vue.js gesammelt.

    Du bringst gute Kenntnisse in HTML/CSS mit und hast Erfahrung mit responsive Webdesign sowie ein hohes Interesse an aktuellen Trends im Bereich UX-/UI-Design.

    Erfahrungen mit Component Libraries wie bspw. Material Design oder PrimeNG sowie State Management Systemen sind von Vorteil.

    Du beherrschst den sicheren Umgang mit Git und verfügst über fundierte Kenntnisse in der Verwendung einer Shell wie Bash, ZSH oder fish.

    Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift runden dein Profil ab.  

 
Deine Benefits

Flexibilität – Deine Arbeitszeit und deinen Arbeitsort kannst du bei uns - in Abstimmung mit den betrieblichen Anforderungen und arbeitsrechtlichen Bestimmungen - selber bestimmen. Dabei gibt es keine Kernarbeitszeiten und du hast die Möglichkeit, im Home Office sowie in über 40 Ländern zu arbeiten.

Weiterentwicklung – Durch unsere interne Academy, internationale Erfahrungen durch Secondments und kontinuierliches Mentoring entwickelst du dich stetig weiter. 

Freizeit – Dank eines Teilzeit-Blockmodells kannst du auch mehrmonatige Auszeiten in Form eines Sabbaticals nehmen. Zusätzlich kannst du bei PwC Deutschland Überstunden auf einem persönlichen Jahresarbeitszeitkonto sammeln. Dabei bleibt es dir überlassen, ob du dir deine Überstunden auszahlen lässt oder flexibel in mehr Freizeit umwandelst.

Gesundheit – Deine Gesundheit liegt uns am Herzen: Neben einer eigenen betrieblichen Krankenkasse bieten wir auch Vorsorgeuntersuchungen sowie Sportangebote an. Nimm an unserem kostenlosen Betriebssportprogramm teil oder profitiere von vergünstigten Beiträgen in diversen Fitnessstudios oder einer Urban Sports Club-Mitgliedschaft.

Das ist noch nicht alles – Wir möchten ein positives Arbeitsumfeld schaffen: Ein Umfeld, in dem flexibles und kreatives Arbeiten möglich ist, in dem Arbeit anerkannt und Leistung honoriert wird und auf das wir stolz sind. Alle Benefits findest du auf unserer Karriereseite.

 

 

Bei PwC Deutschland arbeiten wir daran, entscheidende Herausforderungen zu lösen, nachhaltige Ergebnisse zu schaffen und das Vertrauen in die Wirtschaft und Gesellschaft auszubauen. Wir entwickeln individuelle und bedarfsgerechte Lösungen für Unternehmen. Zu unseren Kunden zählen Unternehmen jeder Größe, Branche und Rechtsform, auf nationaler und internationaler Ebene. Wir sind dort, wo sie uns brauchen. Starte bei PwC mit einem abwechslungsreichen Job für Jurist:innen mit Steuerberatungs-Expertise. Das Aufgabenspektrum reicht von der laufenden Steuerberatung über die Entwicklung nachhaltiger Steuer-, Finanz- und Anlagestrategien bis hin zur Unterstützung eines steueroptimierten Personalmanagements. Freue dich auf vielfältige Aufgaben und ein modernes Arbeitsumfeld in der Rechtsberatung bei PwC.

 
Kontakt

Du hast Fragen zu dieser Position oder deiner Bewerbung?

Melde dich gerne bei Ines Wallenwein unter +49 69 95855225.
skillList: angular, react, vue, typescript, ux, mui, primeng, git, linuxadmin

title: Fullstack Engineer
description:
About Staffbase

In a polarized world, we inspire people to achieve great things together. Our mission is to help organizations unlock the power of inspirational communication so they can thrive in the Narrative Age. Our award-winning communications channels – intranet, employee app and email – deliver experiences that drive engagement and inspire hearts and minds.

We’re headquartered in Chemnitz, Germany, with offices in many locations throughout the world, including New York, London, Berlin and Dresden. Our international team counts more than 750 employees from 45+ nationalities and we have a growing base of 2200+ customers that want to transform their employee experience. We are rapidly scaling, post-Series E ($115 million funding), have strong-growing revenue, and our customers love us.

Hey there! We're on the lookout for talented Fullstack Engineers to join our Staffbase team and help us build an awesome internal communications platform. We are looking for empathetic and motivated team players who are motivated by growth and ownership. Let’s talk! 

As part of our tech stack, we are using: React.js, Javascript, Typescript, Kotlin, Go, Java, MongoDB, Terraform, Docker, Selenium and Cypress, to name a few.

Our environment

    Working with skilled and similar-minded professionals in a team that values diversity and inclusivity.
    We aim  to create a flexible and agile work environment that promotes the well-being and work-life balance of our employees.
    We believe that team events during working hours play a vital role in building an exceptionally effective team, and we encourage them.
    We are enthusiastic about technology and committed to using it to improve the world.

We follow the "You build it, you run it" approach and take pride in it.

What you’ll be doing

    Responsible for improving and developing both our web-based clients, including native apps, and our RESTful web services.
    Work in a cross-functional scrum team and produce high-quality and tested code.
    Give and receive valuable feedback in our code review process and continuously learn and share knowledge with your peers.
    Being open to feedback and taking ownership of your work are essential.
    Take ownership for the topics you care about, ranging from the features you produce over the quality of our work to the environment we work in.
    You work iteratively, frequently pushing code, ensuring a good CI/CD pipeline, and automating where possible.

What you need to be successful

    Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
    Passion about the things you build and want to make a difference.
    Experience in React.js, JavaScript, TypeScript, Kotlin, Go and/or Java.
    Ideally, you have worked with MongoDB, Terraform, Docker before and have an understanding of REST and Microservices, next to that, you are passionate for Test Driven Development.
    Preferably, you have worked in an agile environment before.
    You value quality as well as clean code and learning new things.
    Good English communication skills
    You are a self-starter who can work independently and as part of a team.
    Understanding and appreciative diversity and inclusivity in the workplace.

 

What you’ll get

    Competitive Compensation - we offer attractive salary packages including an Employee Stock Option Plan. 
    Flexibility - we offer flexible working time models and the option of hybrid work, and support this with a yearly flex work allowance of €1560. 
    Growth Budget - all employees get a yearly budget for external training of €1000, and one day off for growth per year (increase to two days in 2nd year). 
    Wellbeing - in addition to our yearly vacation of 30 days, we’re running a 4-day-work week every year in August with full payment. 
    Support - we’re offering a company pension scheme. 
    Sports & Health - join our sport courses in the offices or lease a bike with Staffbase. The offices are equipped with fruits, drinks and snacks. 
    Team Building - Regular team and office events including the yearly Staffbase Camp.
    Volunteers Day - you’ll get one day off per year for supporting a social project. We will donate a small amount for that project in addition. 
    Employee Referral Program - one of your friends is a fit to one of our full-time openings? Refer them and get a referral bonus paid.
skillList: react, typescript, kotlin, go, java, mongodb, terraform, docker, rest, microservices, testing, cleancode

title: Senior Fullstack Engineer
description:
Senior Fullstack Engineer (m/f/d)
at Affinidi (View all jobs)
Berlin, Germany

About the Company

Affinidi is a technology company dedicated to changing data ownership for good. We empower businesses and individuals with control and ownership of their data, with a comprehensive approach to managing their holistic identity – accounting for all aspects of their digital footprint while ensuring privacy and security.

Affinidi’s technology enables users to benefit from decentralised digital identity solutions. We believe that everyone has the right to own and control their data, and we are committed to creating a trusted digital credentials ecosystem that empowers businesses and individuals to securely exchange data and services across borders and industries.

 

About the role:

We are in search of a self-motivated, solution-oriented and experienced Senior Software Engineer to join our Affinidi Elements team. In this role, you will work with global peers on teams dedicated to areas of the product portfolio, from the product, design, infrastructure, architecture, and back/front-end engineering teams. You will be responsible for building high-quality multi-platform application where your expert technical skills will intersect with passion and customer obsession providing the best user experience.

Our work culture at Affinidi is shaped by the following tenets:  

    We are unapologetically customer-focused
    We invest in cultures and teams to enable high performance
    We embrace experimentation and build fast
    We have the courage to be misunderstood
    We work together to unlock data

What’s in it for you:

    Support the entire application lifecycle (concept, design, test, release and support) 
    Actively collaborate with globally distributed teams of engineers, designers and product managers 
    Own medium-large features end-to-end, gather specific requirements and suggest solutions. 
    Develop secure, performant and scalable backend services and REST APIs
    Contribute to frontend UI development 
    Ensure product quality by writing automated tests 
    Collaborate with cross-functional teams and peers on larger projects

You will be a great match if you:

    You have 5+ years of experience in web development 
    You are a passionate developer across both front and back-end with extensive experience using Javascript, Typescipt, Node.js and React. 
    Have experience with performance and optimization problems, and demonstrated ability to both diagnose and prevent such problems
    Have strong experience of building user-friendly, responsive, efficient, and world-class user experience.
    Have extensive expertise in cloud computing and native environments (AWS preferred) 
    Understand design patterns and have working experience in developing and deploying microservices in the cloud, and have a proven track-record in doing so  
    Are hands-on with REST APIs and are able to apply Test Driven Development principles effectively. 
    Care about privacy by design, security, testing, high-performance systems 

Bonus points if you:  

    Have experience with other languages and frameworks (Dart, Flutter, C#, C++, Golang, Rust for example) 
    Have experience with WebAssembly
    Have a good understanding of cryptography.

What can you expect from us: 

    Hybrid working model 
    Flexible working hours 
    Unlimited vacation policy 
    Competitive compensation package 
    Work within international environment 
    Learning Budget 
    Mobile Allowance 
    Home Office Allowance 
    Urban Sport Membership 

Sounds like you? Apply now!
skillList: typescript, node, react, aws, rest, testing, csharp, cplusplus, dart, flutter, go, rust, webassembly

title: Frontend Engineer
description:
Über den Job

Du arbeitest bei sofatutor an einer Online Plattform, die es mit Videos, Übungen und Lernmaterialien über eine Million Schüler*innen ermöglicht, spielerisch zu lernen und gestaltest gemeinsam mit uns die Zukunft digitalen Lernens und Lehrens.
Als Frontend Engineer (gn) im Team Yellow bist du hauptsächlich für die Implementierung neuer Funktionen in sofatutor KIDS, unserem Produkt für early learning, verantwortlich und unterstützt damit das Team bei der Weiterentwicklung dieses neuen und spielerischen Produkts.


Unser Bewerbungsprozess findet aktuell komplett ortsunabhängig statt.
Du wohnst nicht in Berlin? Kein Problem, denn du kannst die Arbeit remote innerhalb von Deutschland und auch in vielen weiteren Ländern ausüben. Bitte bewirb dich unter Angabe deiner Gehaltsvorstellung und deines frühestmöglichen Eintrittsdatums.
Unser Versprechen

Du kannst deine Ideen von Anfang an einbringen und bist nach deinem Onboarding voll für deine Bereiche verantwortlich. Wir werden dich unterstützen und dich die Fäden dort aufnehmen lassen, wo du gerade stehst. Bei Fragen stehen wir dir aber natürlich auch weiterhin jederzeit zur Seite. Bei sofatutor ist es uns außerdem besonders wichtig, dass wir transparent arbeiten und uns gegenseitig regelmäßig Feedback geben.

Hier siehst du auf einen Blick, was dich im Hinblick auf unsere Unternehmenskultur erwartet:

    Ein klares Ziel: Schülern helfen, die Schule besser zu meistern und dabei Spaß zu haben
    Ein Arbeitsumfeld, in dem du deinen Tagesablauf gemeinsam mit deinem Team planst
    Kurze und effiziente Entscheidungswege, die es uns ermöglichen, schnell auf neue Herausforderungen zu reagieren
    Unterstützung bei deiner beruflichen Entwicklung, z.B. durch den Austausch mit den Kollegen in unserem Tech-Team, mit dem Fokus auf Optimierung und Continuous Integration
    Nutzung von Tools wie Slack, Clubhouse, GitHub, CircleCI und Technologien rund um Ruby, Docker und AWS
    Eine offene Feedback-Kultur mit einem begeisterten Team, das sich regelmäßig trifft und immer offen für innovative Ideen ist


Darüber hinaus kannst du dich über folgende Benefits freuen:

    Mobile Benefits, wie Zuschüsse zu Tickets öffentlicher Verkehrsmittel (BVG Ticket in Berlin, Deutschlandticket Job) oder ein „Swapfiets“-Fahrrad in vielen deutschen Großstädten

    Fitness Benefits, wie eine Fitnessstudio oder Urban Sports Club Mitgliedschaft, die dir (auch digital) eine gesunde Abwechslung zum beruflichen Alltag bieten

    Mental Health Benefits, wie die kostenlose Nutzung der Online-Plattform “Bloom”, über die du Zugang zu individueller Beratung und vielen verschiedenen Masterclasses erhältst

    Rabatte auf nachhaltige Produkte über unsere Kooperation mit „FutureBens”, sowie weitere attraktive Vergünstigungen für mehr als 1.500 Anbieter über „Corporate Benefits”

    Friends & Family Rabatte auf unsere digitalen Lernangebote


Wir bei sofatutor arbeiten jeden Tag daran, unser integratives Arbeitsumfeld so weiterzuentwickeln, das deine Entwicklung unabhängig von Geschlecht, Familienstand, sexueller Orientierung, Religionszugehörigkeit, Alter, Behinderungsgrad, Bildungsstand oder Ethnie gefördert wird. Unterstütze uns gern dabei und schließe dich uns an!


Deine Mission

Als Frontend Engineer (gn) im Team Yellow bei sofatutor spielst du eine Schlüsselrolle bei der Gestaltung der Zukunft des digitalen Lernens für Kinder. Dein Hauptaugenmerk wird auf der Entwicklung und Verbesserung der sofatutor Kids-Plattform liegen, die jungen Lernenden spannende und lehrreiche Erfahrungen bietet. Du arbeitest eng mit einem engagierten und leidenschaftlichen Team zusammen und setzt dein Fachwissen ein, um neue Features zu entwickeln und die Funktionalität der Plattform zu verbessern. Deine Beiträge werden sich direkt auf den Bildungsweg unzähliger Schüler/innen auswirken und ihnen helfen, auf spielerische und interaktive Weise zu lernen.
Das werden deine Hauptaufgaben sein:

    Entwicklung von Features für unser Produkt sofatutor KIDS
    Überprüfung von Pull Requests deiner Teammitglieder
    Sicherstellung der Stabilität und Leistung der Plattform durch das Schreiben von Tests und geräteübergreifendes Testen
    Bug Fixing
    Sicherstellung der Modernisierung und des Zustands der Codebase

Deine Startvoraussetzungen

Wir suchen einen talentierten und erfahrenen Frontend Engineer (gn) für unser innovatives Team Yellow bei sofatutor. Der/die ideale Kandidat*in hat einen starken Hintergrund in moderner Webentwicklung und eine Leidenschaft für die Erstellung hochwertiger Lernsoftware. In dieser Funktion arbeitest du mit einem Team aus Entwickler*innen, Designern und Produktmanagern zusammen, um außergewöhnliche Lernerfahrungen für Kinder zu schaffen. Du wirst nicht nur sauberen und effizienten Code schreiben, sondern auch am gesamten Produktlebenszyklus mitwirken, von der Entwicklung und Planung bis hin zur Implementierung und Wartung.
Dies sind weitere Voraussetzungen für die Stelle:

    Mehrere Jahre Erfahrung in der modernen Webentwicklung mit JavaScript und React
    Vertrautheit mit agilen Methoden
    Einen ausgeprägten Sinn für sauberen Code, Best Practices und hohe Qualität
    Ausgezeichnete Kommunikationsfähigkeiten und Teamplayer-Mentalität


Du würdest noch besser passen, wenn du zusätzlich die folgenden Fähigkeiten mitbringst:

    Erfahrung in der mobilen Entwicklung für iOS und Android, einschließlich verwandter Technologien wie Fastlane und Turbo.
    Kenntnisse in QA, BrowserStack und Cross-Device-Tests.
    Erfahrung in der Spieleentwicklung (z.B. Rive, Phaser).
    Kenntnisse in Ruby on Rails
    Erfahrung mit dem gesamten Produktlebenszyklus (Entdeckung, Verfeinerung, Planung, Implementierung, Einsatz, Wartung).
    Erfahrung mit Continuous Deployment.

Du findest dich in diesen Punkten wieder und du bist daran interessiert, die Zukunft des digitalen Lernens mitzugestalten? Dann freuen wir uns auf deine Bewerbung – auch wenn du aktuell vielleicht (noch) nicht alle Anforderungen erfüllen kannst.


Über Uns

Wir von sofatutor sind davon überzeugt, dass Kinder und Jugendliche ihre Lernziele am besten erreichen, wenn sie in ihrem eigenen Tempo lernen und dabei auf verschiedene Lernmedien zurückgreifen können. Dafür hat unser Team eine internationale, digitale Lernplattform geschaffen, die Lernen auf individuelle Weise jederzeit und überall ermöglicht. So bieten wir Schüler*innen die Möglichkeit, sich mithilfe von Lernvideos, interaktiven Übungen, Arbeitsblättern und vielen weiteren Features den Schulstoff anzueignen oder nachzubereiten.
skillList: react, reactnative, flutter, fastlane, rubyonrails, cicd

title: Full-Stack-Entwickler
description:
Full-Stack + Legal Tech = Herausfordernde Greenfield Projekte mit Gestalterischer Freiheit

    Wir schaffen gemeinsam Grundlagen im noch jungen Legal Tech Bereich

    Wir arbeiten in kleinen interdisziplinären Teams und lernen sowohl voneinander als auch miteinander in einem motivierten Startup-Umfeld

title: Senior Frontend Developer (Svelte / React)
description:
Senior/Staff Frontend Developer (Svelte / React)
at Lightspeed Commerce
Berlin, Berlin, Germany

Hi there! Thanks for stopping by 👋

Are you actively looking for a new opportunity? Or just checking the market? Well… you might just be in the right place!

We are looking for a Staff Frontend Developer to join one of our squads where you will be supporting Lightspeed’s Hospitality product group on the mission to expand our reach into new markets and countries while enhancing our advanced hospitality commerce platform. 

For this role specifically, you will be joining the team focused on the Kitchen Display System (KDS), a product that sits in our customer’s kitchen and allows our customers to increase the efficiency of their restaurants. Our mission is to provide the best KDS product out there, that can streamline the processes of our customers, adapt to their needs, improve communication among their staff and ultimately enable them to provide the best dining experience to their guests.

You will join a healthy and collaborative team, continuously improving our engineering practices, and delivering state-of-the-art technology, all while keeping it fun. Above all, your work will change the way the world experiences hospitality.

What you'll be responsible for:

    Working alongside some of the most brilliant minds in the industry, you will contribute to the product by building new features and creative workflows.
    Design and create beautiful, elegant, and functional web applications.
    Mentoring and training more junior members of your team, sharing your expertise 
    Report to the Team Lead of Development and have frequent interactions with Product Managers, Product Designers, and Platform Teams.
    Your daily tasks will be split between development of new features, supporting the existing functionality through bug fixes and improvements and supporting our QA and PM team with customer escalations.
    Take part in daily agile ceremonies, brainstorm on innovative ideas that challenge the status quo, and implement solutions.
    Act as an advocate for the highest code quality and ownership while contributing to the health of the code base.
    Raise the bar and elevate your team by sharing knowledge and best practices while always seeking improvement and progress.

What you'll be bringing to the team: 

    Strong knowledge of modern HTML and JavaScript (ES6+), TypeScript, CSS
    Experience and in-depth knowledge of developing web applications with the Svelte framework
    Knowledge of React.js, Next.js, or similar technologies
    Excellent problem-solving and debugging skills in the context of Web applications
    Solid understanding of Web application concerns 
        Authentication, OAuth2, JWT
        API design, REST, GraphQL
        Performance optimizations
        Security best practices, OWASP
    Experience developing in a back-end for frontend layer 
    Hands on experience with WebSockets
    Familiarity with writing tests (e2e using Cypress) and ensuring the highest coding standards
    Communication skills in English 

 

Even better if you have, but not necessary:

    Experience writing Backend services
    Familiarity with modern cloud infrastructures
    A keen eye for UI/UX design

Who you are:

    We look for problem solvers that do not shy away from tackling complexity and love critical thinkers
    You have a strong will to learn, grow and get out of your comfort zone
    You have great energy and passion for technology 

What’s in it for you

Come live the Lightspeed experience...

    Lots of autonomy, flexible work culture with the option of working remotely or from one of our beautiful offices 
    Genuine career growth opportunities within a company that's continuously expanding.
    Make a meaningful impact by helping merchants grow their businesses through creating or improving products and addressing customer feedback.
    Be part of a team large enough for growth yet agile enough for real impact.
    Work on high-traffic products with a global user base.
    Opportunity to work alongside other highly skilled engineers, learn and expand your skill set, forge wonderful relationships and make your mark within the diverse and inclusive Lightspeed culture, a true Canadian tech success story.

… and enjoy a range of benefits that’ll keep you happy and healthy:

    Lightspeed equity scheme (we are all owners)
    Health & Wellness Credit- expense up to 400 EUR per year towards your gym membership, yoga classes, a new bike or whatever else you do for your health 
    Mental Health Support through the Modern Health App- whether it is meditation, coaching or counseling you need - each employee gets access to this platform 
    People Experience - Our PX benefit allows you to work from pretty much anywhere in the world for 60 days a year 
    LinkedIn Learning: At Lightspeed we believe in having a growth mindset, we provide free access to LinkedIn learning along with your career GPS to help you learn & grow
    Time off to volunteer and give back to your community

To all recruitment agencies: Lightspeed does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. If we have not directly engaged your company in writing to supply candidates for a specific vacancy, Lightspeed will not be responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Lightspeed is a proud equal opportunity employer and we are committed to creating an inclusive and barrier-free workplace. Lightspeed welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Where to from here?
Obviously, this has to be mutually beneficial: we want you to step into a role you love, and we want to offer you a place you’re proud to come to every day. For a glimpse into our world check out our career page here.

Lightspeed is building communities through commerce, and we need people from all backgrounds and lived experiences to do that. We were founded in 2005, in Montreal’s gay village and our original members were all part of the LGBTQ+ community. The ethos of our business has been about inclusion from the very beginning, and we strive to provide a workplace where everyone belongs.

Who we are:
Powering the businesses that are the backbone of the global economy, Lightspeed's one-stop commerce platform helps merchants innovate to simplify, scale, and provide exceptional customer experiences. Our cloud commerce solution transforms and unifies online and physical operations, multichannel sales, expansion to new locations, global payments, financial solutions, and connection to supplier networks.
Founded in Montréal, Canada in 2005, Lightspeed is dual-listed on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE: LSPD) and Toronto Stock Exchange (TSX: LSPD). With teams across North America, Europe, and Asia Pacific, the company serves retail, hospitality, and golf businesses in over 100 countries.
skillList: typescript, svelte, react, nextjs, jwt, rest, graphql, owasp10, websockets, cypress, cloud, ux

Es werden vorrangig Innovationen im Bereich der digitalen Informationsdienstleistungen sowohl innerhalb der Kultureinrichtung als auch für die Öffentlichkeit umesetzt. Der Bereich gliedert sich dazu in zwei Sachgebiete für Online-Dienste & Informationsmanagement sowie Online-Technologien & Entwicklung und ist in ein dynamisches, mit modernen Technologien arbeitendes Entwicklungsumfeld mit eigenen Rechenzentren eingebunden. Dabei handelt es sich um eine unbefristete Festanstellung mit einer 39h Wochenzeit, die für eine ausgewogene Work-Life-Balance durch flexible Arbeitszeiten und Möglichkeiten zum mobilen Arbeiten sorgt.

Zudem wird Ihnen hier neben einem attraktiven Gehaltspaket noch folgendes geboten:

    vielseitige Aufgaben mit großen Gestaltungsspielräumen
    einen interessanten und abwechslungsreichen Arbeitsplatz in zentraler Lage Berlins
    eine sehr gute Arbeitsatmosphäre in einem kooperativen und aufgeschlossenen Team
    Jobticket mit monatlich 40€ Arbeitgeberbeteiligung
    vielfältige Fort- und Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten

Tätigkeiten

    Konzipieren, (Weiter-)Entwickeln und Modernisieren webbasierter Anwendungen und Dienste
    Beraten der Fachbereiche sowie die Anforderungsanalyse hinsichtlich der fachlichen Anforderungen und Wünsche an IT-Lösungen
    (Weiter-)Entwickeln, Testen, Dokumentieren und Pflegen von Software
    Migrieren von Daten sowie Altsystemen in neue Anwendungen oder Technologien
    Durchführen der Anwendungsadministration einschl. Changemanagement sowie Unterstützen bei Monitoring und Logging

Anforderungsprofil

    abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium oder auf das Aufgabengebiet bezogene gleichwertige Kenntnisse und Erfahrungen
    Kenntnisse in den Programmier-/ Skriptsprachen JavaScript (Node.js) oder Python sowie im Bereich moderner Web-Technologien und -Frameworks (z.B. React, Next.js, Flask)
    Erfahrung im Bereich Suchmaschinentechnologie (z.B. SOLR, Elasticsearch)
    Erfahrung im Erstellen von technischen Konzepten und Softwarearchitekturen
    gute Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift

title: Lead Full Stack Engineer
description:
Lead Full Stack Engineer - Smoobu (m/f/d)
at HomeToGo (View all jobs)
Berlin, Berlin, Germany

Explore a new world of possibilities:

Smoobu (www.smoobu.com), a subsidiary of HomeToGo Group, is a fast-growing startup in the vacation rental industry. Smoobu’s all-in-one SaaS solution for private hosts currently manages over 70,000 properties across more than 120 countries. Smoobu’s priority is to help its hosts efficiently manage and grow their business.

Smoobu’s team is the secret to our success. We are an ambitious and international team that are motivated to exceed our customers’ expectations through expert advice and action. We are searching for new colleagues who are looking to take on the exciting challenge of transforming the vacation rental industry and taking it to the next level.

 

Your future contribution:

We’re forming a new team: Partner Integrations

This team’s mission is to assist in generating fast feedback on potential features delivered to Smoobu users via third-party partnerships with companies such as PriceLabs and Nukey. Once an experience has been validated, the learnings will be passed off to larger Product Engineering teams for production-grade development and integration into our Marketplace.

The team will also be tasked with short-cycle improvements of existing Partner Channel integrations with our partners like HomeToGo, AirBnB, and Booking.com. This means extending our interfaces owned by the Import/Export team, collaborating with those colleagues to define an acceptable approach which meets technical standards.

The challenge for the Lead Full Stack Engineer in this team is:

    Work closely with your Product Manager and the Head of Partnerships to identify high-potential opportunities to explore
    Create plans for exploration of the topic space, focusing on the Minimum Testable Product in a MoSCoW manner
    Guide and support an Individual Contributor within the team to maximize their potential through structured professional development planning
    Contribute directly to the technical outcomes with your Developer experience, role modeling good practice 

 

How you’ll add value:

    Uphold standards of practice in the Product Engineering workflow
    Plan the quarterly technical roadmap together with the stakeholders and take responsibility for the team’s ability to deliver
    Be the bar-raiser factor of the team by bringing together technical knowledge, best practices, and critical thinking
    Ensure that the results of your experimentations and investigations are packaged neatly which makes it easy for other teams to pick up

 

You’ll be successful in this role if you:

    Have solid experimentation experience in a product-based environment
    Are an expert in PHP Back End Engineering
    Have hands-on experience in current Web UI development practices (React and TypeScript)
    Are competent in managing requests from multiple business stakeholders
    Have worked in an environment where finding “product market fit” was paramount
    Have experience integrating third-party features into products or providing white-label solutions
    Are interested in pursuing a career in Engineering Leadership, even though you may not yet have any formal responsibilities for managing others
    Are fluent in English

 

Note: We operate a rolling recruitment approach  - no deadlines, just opportunities. Should the volume of applications become too high, we might briefly remove this posting to provide our hiring team the space for thorough and unbiased review. The role will be made available again if we decide we’re still looking for the right fit.

 

Why Smoobu?

Your journey with Smoobu is a two-way street - we’ve got you covered! We offer a diverse variety of benefits to enable your career development and make Smoobu a great place to work, including:

    The essentials: Competitive compensation package, visa sponsorship & relocation assistance*, full IT support & equipment, corporate benefits, modern offices, 27 paid vacation days a year (+ one additional day per year of employment until 32)
    Career growth: 360° feedback, open feedback culture, buddy and mentorship programs from an international team of passionate industry experts 
    Personal development: German & Lithuanian language courses, internal and external workshops & trainings, company & team events, Gympass, clubs & sports (e.g. volleyball, running, yoga classes), psychological support
    Startup spirit: Driven by our Leadership Principles: We are fast, nimble, and results-driven - embodying a startup mentality even as a global, public company. We encourage ownership and enable each other to succeed
    Flexible work approach: Office-led and remote friendly approach; employees are offered remote work flexibility for up to 50% of the year, including work from abroad benefits. Plus, access to a  Travel Industry Card 
    Climate action: Committed to being a pioneer in green travel: HomeToGo Group has achieved an industry-leading “Low Risk” (16), awarded by Morningstar Sustainalytics, and is a proud member of Leaders for Climate Action
    And so much more…

*Certain conditions apply

 

About us:

HomeToGo is the SaaS-enabled marketplace with the world's largest selection of vacation rentals, listing millions of offers from thousands of trusted partners, including Booking.com, Vrbo and TripAdvisor. From vacation homes, cabins, beach houses, apartments, condos, house boats, castles, farm stays and everything in between, HomeToGo combines price, destination, dates and amenities to find the perfect accommodation for any trip worldwide.

Founded in 2014, HomeToGo operates localized apps & websites in 25 countries across Europe, North America, South America, Australia and Asia-Pacific. HomeToGo also operates brands such as Agriturismo.it, AMIVAC, atraveo, Casamundo, CaseVacanza.it, e-domizil, EscapadaRural, Kurzurlaub, Kurz Mal Weg, Tripping.com and Wimdu.

HomeToGo is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to hiring and nurturing exceptional talent, representing various backgrounds, perspectives and skills. We are authentically candid and open-minded, fostering a safe environment for diverse opinions. Our hiring decisions are based on qualifications, merit and business needs. We do not discriminate against race, ethnic origin, gender, sexual orientation, religion, political, ideological or religious views, disability or age.

We are committed to creating and maintaining a workforce of equality and diversity at HomeToGo and to provide opportunities to everyone. We therefore welcome your application even if you aren't completely confident that your experiences fit the job description criteria. We would really love to get to know you!

About Airteam

Do you want to be part of a fast-growing, dedicated team in one of the most innovative start-ups in the German construction and solar industry? Do you want to co-create a digital and climate-neutral product that helps roofers and solar planners make better decisions?

Airteam is a SaaS startup that offers an AI-powered data processing cloud platform specifically for roofers and solar planners. Powered by our product, our customers can turn simple drone data into actionable 3D models and measurement reports.

We are looking for a Mid level Full Stack Developer to join our international, motivated and passionate Team.

Our tech-stack is: GCP, GKE, pub/sub, python, vuejs, django/flask/fastapi, mongodb, postgres, argo.
Tasks

    Build the restful applications that manage our projects from drone data acquisition to the customer delivery of actionable data
    Maintain and improve CI/CD pipelines
    Maintain and improve existing architecture and infrastructure
    Write automated tests to ensure user experience is of highest possible quality

Requirements

    Experience with Python and at least one from [fastapi, flask, django]
    Experience with JavaScript (ES6/7), HTML5, CSS3, with TypeScript knowledge preferred.
    Experience with Vue.js SPAs.
    Familiarity with relational databases like PostgreSQL and ORMs. MongoDB is a plus.
    Experience with Docker & Kubernetes
    Understanding of TDD, Unit tests and functional tests is a plus
    Ability to manage issues via a ticketing system (Ex: Jira)

    The ability to learn new technologies in a short amount of time

Benefits

Flexibility and trust are very important to us, so you have the opportunity for hybrid working and also for workations. That's why we provide each employee with an Urban Sports membership, giving you access to a wide range of fitness and wellness facilities throughout the city. We provide a dedicated budget for your continuous learning journey.

title: Lead Software Engineer
description:
Lead Software Engineer (m/w/d) Angular/ React

Bei MAXIMAGO ziehen wir als Crew an einem Strang - egal ob auf Socken oder in Sneakern, remote oder im Mutterschiff, neu an Board oder erfahrener Deep Diver.

Gemeinsam schaffen wir Fokus und steuern unsere Kunden mit unseren individuellen Softwarelösungen systematisch auf das nächste Level.


DEIN AUFGABENBEREICH BEI UNS


Architektur is key

    Entwicklung tragfähiger Lösungskonzepte und querschnittlicher Architekturen.
    Verantwortung für die Library Auswahl.
    Durchführung der Anforderungsanalyse und Überführung in Lösungskonzepte.
    Durchführung der Risikoanalyse.


Hands on Code

    Entwicklung von Querschnittsfunktionalitäten.
    Durchführung von Code Reviews.


Den Hut auf

    Unterstützung unserer Product Owner und Beratung unserer Kunden aus der technischen Perspektive.
    Fachliche Leitung des Teams mit Fokus auf Kompetenzausbildung und Förderung von Mitarbeiter:innen.


WEN WIR SUCHEN


Dein Tech Stack

    Must have: Angular oder React und NextJS.
    Gerne weitere Technologien, Frameworks und Tools wie: .Net, C#, SQL, Rest API (OpenAI / Swagger).


Dein technischer Erfahrungsschatz

    Mindestens 5 Jahre in technischer Funktion in agilen Entwicklungsprozessen, insbesondere Scrum.
    Mindestens 2 Jahre Entscheidungsträger:in in Bezug auf System Architektur, Entwicklungsstruktur, Patterns und Code Quality.


Dein weiterer Erfahrungsschatz

    Erfahrung in der fachlichen Leitung eines Teams.
    Erfahrung im Umfeld größerer Projektstrukturen.
    Grundlegende Erfahrung im Bereich relationale Datenbanken und CQRS.


Deine Soft Skills

    Zielgruppengerechte Kommunikation.
    Flexibilität und Resilienz.
    Sehr gute Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse.


ARBEITSZEIT IST LEBENSZEIT


CREWlife.

Was uns von anderen unterscheidet? - Unsere CREW. Deutschlandweit verteilt. Ein Team.

Ob mittags am Kicker in unserer Lounge, bei unseren remote company weeklies und bei unseren Events - Unser Team musst du einfach erleben. Man kann sie nur gern haben.

Besonderes Special für uns alle sind unsere CREWdays - 3 Tage im Mutterschiff die volle MAXIMAGO-Power spüren, die Räume mit Ideen, Lachen und entspannten Gesprächen füllen und gemeinsame Erinnerungen schaffen.


Grow like a Pro.

Gemeinsam immer besser werden - Bilde dich mit individuellen Trainings weiter, wachse mit uns und gestalte unsere gemeinsame Zukunft mit.


M:Basics.

Ob mit oder ohne Familie, mit Doggo oder ohne - Unser Standard ermöglicht dir die optimale Work-Life-Balance.

⚓ Bezuschusstes 100 % mobiles Arbeiten deutschlandweit möglich.

⚓ Flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle & Gleitzeit.

⚓ 30 +1 Tage Urlaub.

⚓ Familienspecials: Übernahme von Betreuungskosten, Eltern-Kind-Büro mit kindergerechter Spielecke, flexible Umstrukturierung des Arbeitstags bei kurzfristigem Betreuungsengpass …


MAXfit.

Trainingsraum & wöchentliche (hybride) Workouts mit Personal Trainer, wöchentliche (hybride) Yoga-Sessions, wir übernehmen deine Fitnessstudiobeiträge (bis 50€ brutto) - Jetzt liegt es an dir.


Tasty Breaks.

Unser MAXIMAGO Crewgefühl findet seinen wöchentlichen Höhepunkt am Pizza-Mittwoch im Mutterschiff. Als remote M:Ployee erhältst du einen Lieferando-Gutschein. Obst, Getränke & Snacks kann jeder & keine Sorge - wir natürlich auch.


Get your {code}.

Über die Plattform Corporate Benefits erhältst du Rabatte von 1.500 Anbietern von A wie Anker bis Z wie Zara.


Easy Going.

M:Ployees mit Chaffeurpräferenz profitieren von unserem ÖPNV-Zuschuss. Die geborenen Autofahrer unter uns parken kostenlos in unserer Tiefgarage.


JETZT BEWERBEN!

Wir freuen uns schon sehr auf eine Bewerbung!

Wir sind Angelika und Lisa aus dem People & Culture Team. Bei allen Fragen rund um den Interviewprozess und den Eintritt bei uns sind wir die richtigen Ansprechpartner.

Innerhalb von 1-3 Werktagen melden wir uns und finden einen gemeinsamen Termin für ein erstes Kennenlernen.

Was wir uns dafür wünschen, ist ein Lebenslauf, den Gehaltswunsch und frühestmöglichen Eintrittstermin.

title: Senior Node Engineer
description:
Description

Full-time; Remote, but Preferably Hybrid and located in Lisbon, Portugal or ability to travel there

About Quantum Rift Labs: Quantum Rift Labs is at the cutting edge of blockchain gaming, crafting immersive and innovative games that integrate advanced blockchain functionalities. Our current project, The OCT, is a pioneering on-chain multiplayer mobile clicker game that offers a unique blend of gaming and crypto technologies.

Job Overview:

We are seeking a Backend TypeScript Engineer with extensive experience in large-scale production applications and a deep understanding of Web3 technologies. This role is crucial for building and optimizing backend services that interact seamlessly with blockchain components.

Responsibilities:

    Develop and maintain backend services written in TypeScript, ensuring high performance and responsiveness to front-end requests.
    Design and implement APIs and services that integrate with blockchain technologies, including smart contracts and on-chain transactions.
    Utilize common libraries and tools for connecting to on-chain smart contracts and handling blockchain events (e.g., Web3.js, Ethers.js).
    Work with chain event indexers to manage and utilize blockchain-generated data efficiently.
    Collaborate with front-end developers and product managers to ensure system consistency and improve user experience.
    Engage in all phases of the software development lifecycle, from design to deployment and maintenance.
    Ensure code quality, security, and scalability by implementing automated testing and performing code reviews.

Requirements

    4+ years of experience in backend development using TypeScript, specifically in large-scale, high-availability environments.
    Strong experience with Node.js and related frameworks (such as Express.js).
    Solid understanding of and experience with Web3 development practices and tools, especially related to smart contract interactions and blockchain event processing.
    Experience with performance tuning, bottleneck analysis, and resource optimization in a blockchain environment.
    Proficient in using code versioning tools like Git.
    Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a relevant field, or equivalent practical experience.
    Excellent problem-solving, analytical skills, and the ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.

Benefits

    A central role in a groundbreaking blockchain gaming project.
    Competitive compensation, including salary, equity options, and comprehensive benefits.
    Flexible working conditions with remote options to best support work-life balance.
    A dynamic and inclusive culture that encourages innovation and rewards creativity.

title: Lead Backend Developer
description:
We are a rapidly expanding company in the automotive industry with a nationwide presence. Our software combines the functionalities of a traditional dealer management system with intelligent cloud solutions to minimize organizational efforts in body and paint shops while maximizing workshop productivity.
Whether working from home or at our office in Berlin Charlottenburg, we foster a vibrant and collegial work atmosphere, emphasizing close collaboration, creativity, and initiative. Each team member plays a crucial role!
Right now, we are looking for a Lead Backend Developer (m/w/d) in Berlin.

 
What’s on the Agenda?

    You develop backend features
    You collaborate closely with interdisciplinary teams to integrate frontend components with backend services
    You identify and resolve technical issues and challenges to ensure a robust and reliable backend architecture
    You demonstrate a high level of responsibility and commitment to the success of the product and the team

 
What should you bring?

    Bachelor’s degree in computer science or equivalent professional experience
    Strong communication skills in both English and German
    5 years of experience in backend development
    5 years of experience with Node.js
    Proficiency in JavaScript/Typescript and asynchronous programming
    Experience with Express.js and RESTful APIs
    Familiarity with version control tools like Git
    Precise and independent work ethic with a technical understanding of various applications and their implementation in software solutions
    Hybrid work model: The combination of partially working from home and partially at the office in Berlin Charlottenburg fits well into your routine
    We are looking for a committed team member who wants to collaborate with us long-term

 
Nice to have:

    Familiarity with build tools like Webpack, Babel, etc.
    Experience with Firebase products
    Experience with CI/CD tools like Github Actions

 
What do we bring to the table?

    Competitive salary
    Flexible working hours and a flexible workplace
    Opportunities for professional development and training
    We offer a lot of autonomy and room for creativity
    You will have a varied workday in a young, innovative, and collaborative company
    Short decision-making paths
    We offer you a secure professional perspective, supported by our strong track record and expansion
    State-of-the-art equipment, of course

 
Application:

Please send us your resume and any relevant links, such as a GitHub repository.

Additionally, a few lines about yourself and your motivation to apply specifically to us would be great. We look forward to hearing from you!

 

 
Lead Backend Developer Berlin (m/w/d)
Wir sind ein schnell expandierendes Unternehmen in der Automobilbranche mit bundesweiter Präsenz. Unsere Software vereint die Funktionen eines klassischen Dealer-Management-Systems mit intelligenten Cloud-Lösungen, um den organisatorischen Aufwand in Karosserie- und Lackierbetrieben zu minimieren und gleichzeitig die Produktivität der Werkstätten zu maximieren.
Egal ob vom Homeoffice aus oder im Büro in Berlin Charlottenburg – bei uns herrscht eine lebendige und kollegiale Arbeitsatmosphäre und wir setzen auf enge Zusammenarbeit, Kreativität und Eigeninitiative. Jeder und jede spielt eine entscheidende Rolle.
Momentan suchen wir einen Lead Backend Developer (m/w/d) in Berlin.

 
Was gibt’s zu tun?

    ​​​​​​Du entwickelst Backend-Features
    Du arbeitest eng mit interdisziplinären Teams zur Verbindung von Frontend-Komponenten mit Backend-Services zusammen
    Du identifizierst und behebst technische Probleme und Herausforderungen, um eine robuste und zuverlässige Backend-Architektur sicherzustellen
    Du zeigst ein hohes Maß an Verantwortungsbewusstsein und Engagement für den Erfolg des Produkts und des Teams

 
Was solltest du können und mitbringen?

    Du hast einen Bachelorabschluss im Bereich Informatik oder vergleichbare Berufserfahrung
    Sowohl auf Englisch als auch auf Deutsch kommunizierst du sicher
    Du hast 5 Jahre Erfahrung in der Backend-Entwicklung
    Du hast 5 Jahre Erfahrung mit Node.js
    Du kennst dich sehr gut mit JavaScript/Typescript und asynchroner Programmierung aus
    Du hast Erfahrung mit der Verwendung von Express.js und RESTful APIs
    Versionsverwaltungstools wie Git sind dir vertraut
    Du arbeitest präzise und selbstständig und hast ein technisches Verständnis für die verschiedensten Anwendungen und deren Umsetzung in Softwarelösungen
    Hybrides Arbeitesmodell: Die Kombi aus teilweise Arbeiten im Homeoffice, teilweise im Büro in Berlin Charlottenburg passt gut in deinen Alltag
    Wir suchen nach einem engagierten Teammitglied, das langfristig mit uns zusammenarbeiten möchte

 
Nice to have

    Vertrautheit mit Build-Tools wie Webpack, Babel usw.
    Erfahrung mit Firebase-Produkten
    Erfahrung mit CI/CD-Tools wie Github Actions

 
Was bieten wir dir?

    Du bekommst ein wettbewerbsfähiges Gehalt
    Du hast flexible Arbeitszeiten und einen flexiblen Arbeitsplatz
    Wir bieten dir Möglichkeiten zur beruflichen Weiterentwicklung und Schulungen
    Wir überlassen dir viel Eigenverantwortung und Gestaltungsfreiraum
    Du hast einen abwechslungsreichen Arbeitsalltag in einem jungen, innovativen und kollegialen Unternehmen
    Entscheidungswege sind bei uns kurz
    Wir bieten dir eine sichere berufliche Perspektive, gestützt durch unsere starke Erfolgsbilanz und Expansion
    Natürlich gibt’s State-of-the-art equipment

 
Bewerbung

Bitte schick uns deinen Lebenslauf und alle relevanten Links, wie beispielsweise ein GitHub-Repository. Toll wären außerdem ein paar Zeilen über dich und deine Motivation, dich speziell bei uns zu bewerben.

Wir freuen uns auf deine Nachricht!

title: Senior Fullstack Engineer
description:
About the job
Cognism is a market leader in international sales intelligence. Access to our premium data, has helped a wide variety of global revenue teams change their approach to prospecting, resulting in predictable and prosperous outcomes.

Following multiple successful funding rounds and the acquisition of Mailtastic (2020), an email signature solution provider, and Kaspr (2022), a Paris-based sales prospecting tool, there has never been a more exciting time to join us.

As we grow, one of our main objectives is to continue hiring individuals, who are both a professional and cultural fit for our Company. Our values are at the core of everything we do!

 Our people; 

     Are Nice! 
     Are Collaborative. We’re in this together! 
     Are Solution-Focused. For every problem, we’ve got a solution! 
    Are Understanding.
    Celebrate Individual Contributors.

We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive global workplace, which encourages you to achieve any goals you may have, while having fun along the way!

Role Overview

As our Senior Fullstack Engineer, you will be a key contributor to both our backend and frontend technology vision and strategy. You will be deeply involved in high-level architectural decisions, ensuring that our technology stack scales effectively with our growth. This role requires a proactive approach to managing technical debt and maintaining rigorous testing standards to ensure that our systems remain robust, maintainable, and adaptable to future needs.

What You’ll Be Doing

    Fullstack Development: Lead the design and implementation of robust, scalable, and secure systems across both backend and frontend.
    Mentorship: Mentor and guide the engineering team on best development practices across both backend and frontend technologies.
    Technical Debt Management: Proactively identify, prioritize, and address technical debt to ensure long-term code quality and maintainability.
    Testing: Develop and maintain automated tests to ensure code quality, reliability, and performance.
    Problem Solving: Troubleshoot complex fullstack issues and guide the team in finding and implementing effective solutions.
    Collaboration: Work closely with our engineering team, Engineering Manager, and Product Manager to drive the technology vision and strategy.
    Continuous Improvement: Advocate for continuous improvement practices within the team, ensuring our codebase and infrastructure evolve with our business needs.

Our Tech Stack

    Backend: NodeJS, Javascript, TypeScript, MongoDB, RabbitMQ
    Frontend: ReactJS
    API: REST, GraphQL
    Infrastructure: AWS

Key Qualifications

    Experience: Proven experience (minimum 5 years) as a Fullstack Engineer or in a similar senior role, focusing on high-level architecture, strategy, and vision.
    Technical Skills: Proficiency in NodeJS, TypeScript, MongoDB, RabbitMQ, and ReactJS. Experience with GraphQL is a plus.
    Testing Skills: Strong experience in developing and maintaining automated tests (unit, integration, end-to-end) to ensure code quality and reliability.
    Leadership: Strong leadership and mentorship skills.
    Strategic Thinking: Exceptional ability to translate business requirements into scalable technical solutions.
    Technical Debt Management: Experience in identifying and managing technical debt, ensuring long-term maintainability of codebases.
    Project Management: Familiarity with Scrum project management methodology.
    SaaS Industry: Understanding of the Software as a Service (SaaS) industry.

We look forward to hearing from you!
skillList: react, node, typescript, mongodb, rabbitmq, rest, graphql, aws, testing, saas

title: Senior Fullstack Engineer
description:
Senior Fullstack Engineer - MetaMask

CANADA - Remote, EMEA - Remote, LATAM - Remote, UNITED STATES - Remote

Full-time
Apply

Our mission is to unlock the collaborative power of communities by making Web3 universally easy to use, access, and build on.

Working with Consensys puts you at the forefront of an evolving paradigm, transforming our society for the better. We fundamentally believe blockchain is the next generation of technology that can lay the foundation for a more just and equitable society. 

Blockchain tech is just over 10 years old. Ethereum itself is still a toddler and we’re far from reaching our full potential. You’ll get to work on the tools, infrastructure, and apps that scale these platforms to billions of users. 

You’ll be constantly exposed to new concepts, ideas, and frameworks from your peers, and as you work on different projects — challenging you to stay at the top of your game. You’ll join a network of entrepreneurs and technologists that reaches the edge of our ecosystem. Consensys alumni have moved on to become tech entrepreneurs, CEOs, and team leads at tech companies. 

About Metamask

MetaMask aims to create a thriving engineering organization that supports the well-being of our engineers while empowering them to do work they are proud of and enjoy. We strive for an environment that gives our people high trust and autonomy, while also facilitating collaboration, communication and camaraderie among teams and teammates. We aspire to build a diverse engineering team, inclusive to people from all backgrounds and demographics. It is also of great importance to us that working at MetaMask is an experience that catalyzes career growth and learning.

What you’ll do

This Senior Fullstack Engineer will contribute to MetaMask’s bridging experience. We are looking for creative, talented and passionate individuals who are willing to dive deep into the complexity and challenges of blockchain and web3 and help deliver best-in-class experiences to our users across our multiple platforms (Portfolio, browser extension and mobile app). As a senior fullstack engineer, you will help unify, enhance and transform our bridge experience across platforms.

Would be great if you brought this to the role

    6+ years working with web and mobile-based technologies.
    Hands-on experience with at least one: React, React Native, Vue, or Angular.
    Extensive experience with modern Javascript (ES6/TypeScript/etc.).
    Fundamental knowledge of CSS and CSS preprocessors
    Strong working knowledge developing cross platform/browser compatibility. 
    Experience working in an agile development team.
    Experience developing medium to large-scale applications across the entire stack with minimal tech debt through sensible abstractions, testing, linting, and adherence to coding/web standards.
    Experience consuming APIs.
    A demonstrable understanding of Continuous Integration.
    Strong understanding of web-based security threats and prevention techniques.

Bonus Points:

    Working knowledge of blockchain bridges and L2 ecosystem.
    Demonstrated passion for and knowledge of blockchain technologies, especially DeFi.
    An understanding of cyber-cryptography.
    Experience working in a decentralized, distributed team.
    Experience with mobile development, particularly react native.

Other skills to demonstrate:

    Excellent verbal and written communication in English.
    Teamwork, flexibility, initiative, communication and organization.
    Willingness to constantly learn & improve, challenging yourself to stay at the top of your game.

Don't meet all the requirements? Don't sweat it. We’re passionate about building a diverse team of humans and as such, if you think you've got what it takes for our chaotic-but-fun, remote-friendly, start-up environment—apply anyway, detailing your relevant transferable skills in your cover letter. While we have a pretty good idea of what we need, we're ready for you to challenge our thinking on who needs to be in this role.

Consensys is an equal opportunity employer. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply. We are committed to ensuring that our technology is made available and accessible to everyone. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Consensys is aware of fraudulent recruitment practices and we encourage all applicants to review our best practices to protect yourself which can be found (https://consensys.io/careers/best-practices-to-avoid-recruitment-fraud/).

#LI-HG1

The salary range for US-based candidates only will be determined throughout the interview process depending on experience and skills.
US pay range (not including bonus, equity or other benefits)
$118,000—$243,000 USD

title: Senior Fullstack Engineer
description:
Senior) Developer Fullstack (Typescript / Javascript / Node.js)
Berlin, Germany Backend Data Science Deep tech Docker Frontend Fullstack Go Golang JavaScript Kubernetes NodeJS Python ReactJS TypeScript	

🚀 DATATRONiQ stands out as a pioneering deep-tech 💪 startup for the industrial IoT in Germany. Our platform offers a one-stop solution for companies to monitor and optimize their assets and processes. Our device management and data acquisition technology generate high-quality data for our AI models deployed on edge. We believe in an open and collaborative environment to foster the best ideas from the most creative people, and we want to talk to you!

As a (senior) fullstack developer at DATATRONiQ, you will have the opportunity to work on a cutting-edge IoT platform that utilizes AI to analyze data from industrial processes. Our platform uses machine learning algorithms to detect anomalies and identify patterns that may indicate potential issues with equipment and continuously monitors the quality of parts. Our platform also provides IIoT device management and software connectors for data acquisition from a very broad range of manufacturing machines and control systems.

We are looking for multiple skilled Typescript (Javascript) fullstack developers (or those who want to become one) to join our team. You will be responsible for developing and maintaining the dashboard stack (React, Koa/Express), which is run on Kubernetes and communicates with a handful of microservices written in Golang and Scala. You should have experience working with Typescript (or Javascript), as well as a strong understanding of fullstack development; ideally you have a good eye for design/UI/UX and are also interested in working with AI and machine learning technologies, as well as data analysis and visualization in general.

At DATATRONiQ, you will be a key member of our engineering team and start contributing from day one. We continuously improve our development processes and take pride in our commitment to delivering high-quality products. To do so, we make a real effort to rank at the top of the Joel Test for engineering teams. We aim to create a healthy and productive engineering environment and encourage collaboration between remote and on-site team members. We do regular pair-programming sessions, and on Fridays we meet (online and offline) to finish the week with a mix of hackathons and show and tell.

What are your responsibilites?

    Work in an agile environment to ship frontend and backend components; be curious about new tech
    Implement new features using Typescript and Javascript (Node.js & Express in the backend, React & Storybook in the frontend) and keep the overall stack up-to-date
    Advocate for high-quality code and appreciate good tests/coverage; occasionally write or improve tooling to further automate manual steps
    Actively contribute to decision-making processes how we build new features and participate in shaping the product roadmap

What is your qualification?

    Completed studies in the field of computer science, mathematics, physics or similar
    Good programming skills and solid knowledge of agile software development
    Expertise in working with databases
    Openness for new technologies
    Great written and spoken English; German is a plus
    A high level of commitment, initiative and enthusiasm for IT
    A bonus, but not mandatory: familiarity with technologies such as React, Storybook, Node.js, Docker/Kubernetes, e2e testing, and Linux

What can you expect?

    Participation in a young company in a future-oriented industry
    Implementation of artificial intelligence in the context of industrial IoT
    Attractive workplace with innovative technology and modern equipment; hybrid work is also possible
    Exciting challenges and recognition for top performances
    A company culture where honesty, professionalism, and integrity run deep
    Flat hierarchies, quick decision-making processes, and an agile company structure
    Budget for personal and professional development as well as for equipment of your choice
    Snacks, beverages, subscription for Spotify, public transport ticket
    Competitive salary commensurate with experience and market standards

Did we spark your interest?

This is a unique and exciting opportunity to work on a product that has the potential to make a significant impact in the industrial manufacturing sector.
DATATRONiQ platform is built with TypeScript, Golang, Python, Scala, C++ and deployed as microservices on various Cloud environments and on-prem virtual machines using Kubernetes.

If you are passionate about using your skills to solve challenging problems and make a difference, we really would like to talk to you.

Get in touch with us at work@datatroniq.com or visit us at https://datatroniq.com/en/career

We are looking forward to your application!

We ask recruitment agencies and headhunters to refrain from contacting us.
skillList: react, typescript, node, go, python, docker, kubernetes, testing, storybook, linuxAdmin

title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
Engineering · Berlin, Germany
Full Stack Engineer - JavaScript
Join Klarna's engineering community, where you'll be part of a customer-centric community that thrives in Agile collaboration, innovating solutions that continuously redefine the industry.

We usually respond within two weeks

Engineering at Klarna is an inspired, customer focused community, dedicated to crafting solutions that redefine our industry. Working in small, highly collaborative Agile teams, you and your team will have a clear mission and ownership of an important outcome that supports Klarna and our customers.

At Klarna we optimize for quality, flow, fast feedback, focusing on end-to-end ownership, continuous improvement, testing, monitoring and experimentation. We aim for teams that are inclusive, helpful, and have a strong sense of ownership for the things they build. Our engineers make some of the most significant decisions for the company and we are looking for bold, open and curious developers. As a Klarnaut, you’ll be inspired to contribute to the growth of one of the World's most highly valued fintech, and your work will impact the lives of our millions of users.

We're expanding several of our engineering teams, including; teams working on our core checkout product, payment services, fraud prevention, or improving our billing service and shipping credentials to name a few.

Help us make shopping online even more smoooth!
What you'll get to do:

        Work with large scale, highly available and resilient modern financial systems.
        Be an integral part of a team, in addition to its culture and ways of working. Common practices include agile methodologies, pair and mob programming.
        Work with automated deployment enabling code release multiple times a day.
        Succeed, fail, and learn together with other talented people. We believe in an environment that provides an opportunity for growth and see education as an outcome of failure that gets us closer to the next breakthrough.
        Work with modern tools and languages that excite you.

You should have:

        A strong coding ability in TypeScript using Node.js
        Experience with common JavaScript libraries and frameworks.
        Work experience using React and React Native
        Experience with product development cloud and microservices.
        A passion for writing clean and testable code.
        Experience with Agile practices (Pairing, TDD, BDD, Continuous Integration, Continuous Delivery).

Some of the technologies we work with:

        JavaScript /TypeScript
        React + React Native with Redux
        Node.js and Express.js
        REST API and GraphQL API
        Kafka
        Internal design system
        AWS, Splunk, Datadog, Jenkins and Docker.

Department
    Engineering 
Locations
    Berlin, Germany 
Employment type
    Full-time 

About Klarna

Since 2005 Klarna has been on a mission to revolutionize the retail banking industry. With over 150 million global active users and 2 million transactions per day, Klarna is meeting the changing demands of consumers by saving them time and money while helping them be informed and in control.

Over 450,000 global retail partners, including H&M, Saks, Sephora, Macys, IKEA, Expedia Group, and Nike have integrated Klarna's innovative technology to deliver a seamless shopping experience online and in-store. Klarna has over 3,500 employees and is active in 45 markets.
Founded in 2005
Co-workers 3,500
Turnover 23.5B SEK

title: Senior Frontend Developer
description:

Eine richtig gute User Experience wird im Frontend umgesetzt. Hier kommt auf die Straße, was begeistert, was mitreißt, was animiert und was konvertiert. Wir finden sehr wohl, dass Frontend-Development manchmal Raketenwissenschaft ist. Es macht uns Spaß, die Rakete zu entwerfen und zu bauen. Dir auch?

Du entwickelst seit mehreren Jahren professionell Web-Application-Frontends mit React, Vue.js oder Svelte, machst Testing mit Jest und kennst Building-Tools wie Webpack? Du suchst nach technischen Sparringspartner: innen, von denen du noch was lernen kannst? Du hast gleichzeitig Lust, neue Talente aufzubauen und an deinem Wissensschatz teilhaben zu lassen? Dann lass uns das gemeinsam machen!

Tasks

    Selbstständige Entwicklung, Umsetzung und Integration von webbasierten Applikationen mit modernen Frontend-Technologien
    Proaktives Arbeiten im Team und Anleitung von Teammitgliedern
    Abstimmung mit deinen Team-Kolleg: innen wie Product Ownern, Tester: innen, Designer: innen, Backend, Consultants und unseren Kunden
    Dinge vorantreiben, Ideen umsetzen, Mitreißen

Requirements
